I have exposed AgentKit as an agent in the BE apis. The goal here is to inspire people with a bit of story telling. This iHow it's MadeJust Next.js on the frontend and express on the BE with agentkit. for story generation . I have created a simple frontend to generate prompts based on user's selection of virtues. Based on that the story is generated by AgentKit and rendered on UX. I have exposed AgentKit as an agent in the BE apis. The goal here is to inspire people with a bit of story telling. This i
summary: It teaches virtues by exemplifying famous personalities. It is deployed on vercel.

title: WareAI
description: Project DescriptionOur AI-powered warehouse management tool optimizes inventory, automates order processing, and enhances efficiency with real-time tracking, smart routing, and demand forecasting. It reduces costs, minimizes errors, and integrates seamlessly with robotics and existing systems for faster, smarter logistics.How it's MadeWe built the Warehouse Management AI Agent using AgentKit and Autonome, leveraging their modular AI agent framework for automation and real-time decision-making. The smart contract backbone is deployed on Base, ensuring secure, transparent, and efficient warehouse operations with on-chain integrations. Tech Stack & Architecture: AgentKit & Autonome: Used for developing and deploying autonomous AI agents that handle inventory tracking, demand forecasting, and order fulfillment automation. Base Blockchain: Smart contracts deployed on Base enable secure tracking of inventory, order verification, and automated payments within the supply chain. AI & ML: Trained models predict demand fluctuations, optimize warehouse layouts, and reduce order errors. Gazebo Harmonic: Integrated for high-fidelity warehouse simulation, enabling AI agents to test and optimize robotic movements, storage efficiency, and automated fulfillment in a physics-accurate virtual environment.
summary: Revolutionizing warehouse management with an AI agent that optimizes inventory, predicts demand, automates workflows, and reduces costs. Smarter logistics, fewer errors, and faster fulfillment‚Äîall powered by AI.

title: HyprStark
description: Project DescriptionHyprStark is a social NFT platform where every uploaded image is minted as an NFT on the blockchain. It combines the features of a social media platform with a dynamic NFT marketplace, enabling users to interact with NFTs through likes, comments, and views. The platform dynamically adjusts NFT prices based on engagement metrics, creating a unique and interactive experience for users.How it's MadeFrontend: React : For modern styling with dark mode support. Backend: Express.js, Prisma ORM with PostgreSQL (for engagement tracking, dynamic pricing updates, and NFT price data batching). Cairo smart Contract for integration with StarkNet for blockchain interactions. Dynamic Pricing Algorithm: Likes increase the price by 1%, comments by 5%, and views by 0.1%. Prices are capped at 3x the base price to prevent runaway inflation. Smart Contracts: Functions for minting NFTs (mint), updating prices (set_price), and transferring ownership (buy_NFT).
summary: HyprStark is designed to revolutionize how NFTs are created and valued by integrating social engagement dynamics into the NFT ecosystem. By tying NFT prices to user interactions, it fosters creativity, community engagement, and a vibrant marketplace for digital assets.

title: AgentLink
description: Project DescriptionAgentLink is an AI-powered messaging agent that enables users to interact with blockchain networks using SMS and WhatsApp. Built on Base Chain and powered by Coinbase AgentKit, it allows users to send funds, mint NFTs, deploy smart contracts, and manage on-chain transactions‚Äîall through simple text-based communication. By integrating Gaia Node‚Äôs LLM for AI processing and AVS Eigen Layer for decentralized validation, AgentLink ensures secure and seamless blockchain interactions. This approach eliminates the need for complex apps, making Web3 accessible to users even in low-connectivity regions. Unlike most blockchain bots that rely on Telegram, AgentLink brings decentralized finance (DeFi) to billions of WhatsApp and SMS users, especially in regions with limited internet access. Users can perform on-chain transactions, deploy smart contracts, and automate Web3 actions with a simple message. The system processes requests using AI, executes transactions on Base Chain, and validates them through AVS Eigen Layer, ensuring security and trust. By bridging familiar communication tools with advanced blockchain functionalities, AgentLink is driving mass adoption of Web3 technology‚Äîwithout the need for specialized knowledge or additional apps.How it's MadeAgentLink is built using a combination of blockchain, AI, and messaging technologies, integrating Coinbase AgentKit, Base Chain, Gaia Node LLM, and AVS Eigen Layer to enable secure Web3 transactions via SMS and WhatsApp. When a user sends a message, Gaia Node‚Äôs LLM processes the request, extracts intent, and formats it for execution. Coinbase AgentKit then interacts with Base Chain to execute on-chain transactions such as fund transfers, NFT minting, and smart contract deployment. To ensure trust and security, AVS Eigen Layer provides Active Validation Services (AVS), leveraging decentralized restaking mechanisms to validate transactions independently, preventing fraud and enhancing reliability. For messaging, Twilio for SMS and the WhatsApp Business API handle user interactions, ensuring smooth communication without requiring additional apps. A unique aspect of AgentLink is its multi-layer fallback mechanism, which automatically switches between WhatsApp and SMS based on network conditions, ensuring uninterrupted blockchain access. AI-driven error handling and retry logic optimize transaction efficiency, reducing failures due to minor input mistakes. By merging Web3 infrastructure with traditional messaging, AgentLink creates an accessible, secure, and intuitive blockchain experience for users worldwide. üöÄ
summary: AgentLink enables seamless blockchain transactions via SMS & WhatsApp‚Äîsend funds, mint NFTs, and deploy smart contracts without an app! Built on Base Chain with Coinbase AgentKit, Gaia Node LLM, and AVS Eigen Layer for security. Blockchain for everyone, anywhere!

title: TradeSync
description: Project DescriptionTradeSync is a cutting-edge decentralized trading platform that leverages AI and blockchain to provide an autonomous, secure, and intelligent trading experience. The platform enables users to connect their wallets, track real-time market data, and execute AI-driven trades with built-in risk management protocols. At its core, TradeSync utilizes Warden AI Agent Kit to analyze market trends and execute trades autonomously. Nillion is used for secure data storage, ensuring users' sensitive financial information is protected without centralized control. The Base-Sepolia smart contracts enforce risk management rules, executing trades and preventing overexposure automatically. The platform offers a subscription-based model, where users can access premium AI trading features by making on-chain payments. A sleek Next.js-powered frontend provides a smooth, interactive experience with real-time data visualization. Express.js manages the backend, processing user requests and trade executions efficiently.How it's MadeTradeSync is a next-generation decentralized AI-powered trading platform that seamlessly integrates artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, and decentralized computing to provide a secure and efficient trading experience. The platform is designed to offer real-time market insights, automated trade execution, and advanced risk management using smart contracts. The frontend of TradeSync is built with Next.js, ensuring a fast and dynamic user experience. It is styled with Tailwind CSS to maintain a sleek, responsive, and visually appealing design. MobX is used for state management, allowing efficient tracking of market data and user interactions. On the backend, Express.js serves as the core API layer, handling essential functions such as trade execution, user authentication, and AI-driven analytics. The Warden AI Agent Kit is integrated into the backend, leveraging LangChain to provide AI-driven decision-making and automated trading strategies. To ensure secure data handling, Nillion is used for decentralized data storage, protecting sensitive user information without relying on traditional centralized databases. This enhances privacy and security while maintaining efficient data accessibility. Smart contracts play a crucial role in TradeSync‚Äôs trading automation and risk management. Built on Base-Sepolia, these Solidity-based contracts enforce trade execution rules, manage risk limits, and facilitate seamless on-chain transactions. By combining AI-driven analytics, decentralized finance principles, and automated execution, TradeSync is revolutionizing the way traders interact with blockchain-based financial markets. üöÄ
summary: TradeSync is a decentralized AI-powered trading platform with risk management and autonomous trading. It leverages Warden AI, Nillion, and Base-Sepolia smart contracts for secure, efficient, and AI-driven trading with real-time insights and portfolio optimization. üöÄüìà

title: Agent Elonos
description: Project DescriptionAgent Elonos is an autonomous agent who interacts with other users via X and Discord platforms. He can help users perform copy trading from expert traders in decentralized exchanges. Agent Elonos is a Based agent who monitors the base chain for pump and dump activities to alert and publish the trades to his followers. He will also perform some of the users requests for onchain activity such as deploying a ERC20 Token or NFT token. He will also try to mimic some of the trades by buying them in for himself and will wholeheartedly airdrop some of the tokens to his loyal followers. Agent Elonos is real Alpha Agent.How it's MadeStarted with Coinbase Agentkit example (langchain-cdp-chatbot) , the project evolved by adding the X(Twitter) interaction capabilities to the agent from Agentkit. As the Twitter interaction was getting constant API limit error 429, it was decided to add another channel to communicate with the agent. So code changes to add Discord were done. ( along with new channel and BOT creation in Discord) , Dabbled with multiple LLMs supported by Langachain to enhance the customer experience and reduce the cost, Post to Emile Baizel's session, realized that Agent needs to be equipped with the AWS Blockchain data to achieve his goal. As time was limited, as a precursor, implemented integration with Bedrock only for LLM ( along with setting accounts with AWS and AWS IAM for the users) in the current project but will continue to build and integrate the AWS Blockchain data.
summary: One stop Autonomous Agent to follow on X and Discord for Alpha.

title: Cosmic
description: Project DescriptionDescription Cosmis is an advanced crypto AI agent that seamlessly integrates cutting-edge blockchain technologies with sophisticated natural language processing capabilities. Designed to empower cryptocurrency enthusiasts and professionals alike, Cosmis offers a comprehensive suite of features that simplify and enhance the management of digital assets. By automating complex tasks and providing intelligent insights, Cosmis ensures users can navigate the crypto landscape with ease and confidence. Key Functionalities: Autonomous Wallet Management: CDP Smart Wallet Integration: Utilizes the Safe Protocol to enable decentralized custody solutions. Multi-signature Wallets: Facilitates the creation and management of wallets that require multiple approvals for transactions, enhancing security. Secure Transaction Execution: Ensures all transactions are executed securely, minimizing the risk of unauthorized access. Threshold Signature Support: Implements threshold signatures to further bolster wallet security by distributing signing capabilities. NFT Deployment via Natural Language: Natural Language Commands: Allows users to deploy ERC-721 NFTs using intuitive, human-readable instructions. AI-Powered Contract Generation: Leverages AI to automatically generate smart contract code tailored to user specifications. Automated Deployment Process: Streamlines the NFT deployment process, reducing the need for manual coding and interventions. OpenAI Integration: Integrates with OpenAI to enhance code generation capabilities, ensuring robust and optimized NFT contracts. Cross-chain Arbitrage Detection: Real-time Price Monitoring: Continuously monitors cryptocurrency prices across the Base Sepolia testnet and other relevant networks. Automated Arbitrage Detection: Identifies and alerts users to profitable arbitrage opportunities between different exchanges and blockchain networks. Configurable Profit Thresholds: Allows users to set minimum profit margins for arbitrage opportunities, ensuring operations align with their investment strategies. Cross-chain Price Comparison: Compares prices of assets across multiple chains to pinpoint discrepancies that can be exploited for profit. Secure Configuration with Nillion: Threshold Encryption: Protects sensitive data through advanced encryption techniques, ensuring only authorized parties can access critical information. Secure Key-Value Storage: Provides a reliable and secure method for storing configuration settings and other sensitive data. Policy-Based Access Control: Implements granular access controls based on predefined policies, ensuring that data access aligns with user permissions. Distributed Security Model: Enhances security by distributing data and access controls across multiple nodes, reducing the risk of centralized breaches. Cosmis stands out as a holistic solution for crypto management, combining automation, security, and intelligence to deliver a superior user experience. Whether managing wallets, deploying NFTs, or capitalizing on arbitrage opportunities, Cosmis equips users with the tools they need to thrive in the dynamic world of cryptocurrency.How it's MadeHow It's Made The development of Cosmis is a testament to the synergy between modern web technologies and blockchain innovations. By meticulously selecting and integrating a diverse set of tools and frameworks, Cosmis delivers a robust, scalable, and secure platform for cryptocurrency management. Technological Stack: Frontend: React.js: Powers the user interface, providing a responsive and interactive experience for users to manage their crypto assets effortlessly. TypeScript: Enhances code reliability and maintainability by introducing static typing to JavaScript, reducing runtime errors. Backend: Node.js: Serves as the backbone of the server-side operations, handling API requests, managing wallet interactions, and orchestrating NFT deployments. Express.js: Facilitates the creation of robust APIs, enabling seamless communication between the frontend and backend components. Blockchain Integrations: Safe Protocol: Implements decentralized and secure wallet management solutions, ensuring user funds are protected through multi-signature and threshold signatures. OpenAI API: Integrates natural language processing capabilities, allowing users to interact with Cosmis using conversational commands and facilitating AI-driven code generation for NFT contracts. Nillion: Provides advanced encryption and distributed security features, safeguarding sensitive configuration data and ensuring compliance with security best practices. Base Sepolia Testnet: Utilized for testing and deploying cross-chain arbitrage functionalities, ensuring that Cosmis operates smoothly across different blockchain environments. Additional Tools: Webpack: Bundles the frontend assets, optimizing performance and load times. Babel: Transpiles modern JavaScript and TypeScript code for compatibility across various browsers and environments. Jest: Implements testing frameworks to ensure code quality and reliability through comprehensive unit and integration tests.
summary: Cosmis is an intelligent crypto AI agent that combines advanced blockchain features with natural language processing capabilities.

title: EmploAi
description: Project DescriptionEmploAI is a revolutionary platform that introduces the concept of AI agent employment, reimagining how businesses integrate AI capabilities. Operating on the Flow blockchain (EVM), the platform serves as a comprehensive ecosystem for discovering, hiring, and managing specialized AI agents. At its core, EmploAI features a sophisticated marketplace showcasing specialized AI agents. The Personal Assistant (PA) handles scheduling, reminders, and task management across platforms like Discord and Telegram. The Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) manages social media strategy and content across major platforms including Twitter and LinkedIn. The Chief News Analyst (CNA) provides real-time news analysis and summaries from various sources. The platform integrates deeply with Coinbase's infrastructure. Real-time pricing data is fetched through the Coinbase Price API, enabling dynamic price display in multiple currencies including USD, EUR, GBP, and more. Each agent's subscription price, set in FLOW tokens, automatically converts to the user's preferred currency. The Coinbase Onramp integration facilitates seamless fiat-to-crypto conversion for users who want to purchase subscriptions without holding cryptocurrency. Access control is managed through smart contracts deployed on the Flow EVM. When a user subscribes to an agent, the smart contract records their subscription details including start date and duration. The contract automatically verifies access rights when users attempt to interact with agents. This system supports monthly subscriptions with automatic expiry tracking and renewal options. Each agent comes with specialized platform integrations. The Personal Assistant connects with Discord, Telegram, Google Calendar, and Slack for comprehensive task and schedule management. The CMO integrates with Twitter/X, LinkedIn, Instagram, and TikTok for social media management and trend analysis. The News Analyst connects to major news sources including Reuters and Bloomberg for real-time information processing. The platform includes a community-driven feature request system. Users can submit requests for new agent capabilities, with suggestions priced in FLOW tokens. Other users can upvote these requests, helping prioritize development. Request status tracking moves from pending through in-progress and planned to completed, providing transparency in development. The technical infrastructure centers around a smart contract deployed at 0x151D3c8E531d9726148FF64D5e8426C03D0e91eF on Flow EVM. This contract manages agent registration, subscription purchases, access control, and feature requests. The frontend uses Next.js 13 with the App Router, employing TypeScript for type safety and TailwindCSS for styling. Web3 integration is handled through ethers.js. Wallet connection is managed globally through the navbar, allowing seamless access across the platform. Users can connect via MetaMask and switch to the Flow network if needed. The interface provides real-time price conversions, interactive agent cards, and comprehensive subscription management tools. Looking ahead, EmploAI plans to expand its agent offerings, enhance integration capabilities, and introduce advanced analytics. Future developments include custom agent configuration options and bulk subscription packages for enterprise users. The platform serves various use cases, from businesses needing AI assistance to marketing teams requiring data analysis, traders seeking real-time news insights, and individuals looking for personal task management. By combining blockchain technology with intuitive user interfaces, EmploAI makes AI agent integration accessible while maintaining enterprise-grade security and functionality. EmploAI represents a significant step forward in AI integration for businesses, offering a secure, transparent, and user-friendly platform for accessing specialized AI capabilities through a subscription model. The combination of blockchain technology, real-time pricing, and comprehensive platform integrations creates a unique ecosystem for the future of AI employment.How it's MadeEmploAI was built by integrating the Flow EVM blockchain with a modern web stack, focusing on secure subscription management and seamless user experience. The core smart contract, written in Solidity, handles subscription management and agent access control. It's deployed on Flow EVM testnet, chosen for its high throughput and low costs. The contract manages agent creation, subscription purchases, access verification, and feature requests. Each agent is represented as a struct containing its properties, integrations, and features, while subscriptions track user access and expiry dates. The frontend is built with Next.js 13 using the App Router, providing server-side rendering and optimal performance. TypeScript ensures type safety across the application, particularly crucial when handling blockchain interactions. TailwindCSS powers the styling, enabling rapid development of a responsive, modern interface. Web3 integration is handled through ethers.js, with a custom context provider managing wallet connections and contract interactions. This context, accessible throughout the application, maintains wallet state and provides methods for contract interactions. MetaMask integration includes automatic network detection and switching to Flow EVM when needed. Coinbase APIs play a vital role in the platform's functionality. The Price API provides real-time FLOW/USD rates and cross-currency conversions. We fetch these rates every 60 seconds, ensuring accurate pricing across multiple currencies. The prices are cached client-side to minimize API calls while maintaining accuracy. For real-time price conversions, we implemented a currency conversion system that handles both FLOW and USDT prices. The system calculates equivalent values in nine major currencies (USD, EUR, GBP, JPY, AUD, CAD, CHF, INR, CNY) using current exchange rates. This gives users flexibility in viewing and understanding pricing in their preferred currency. The marketplace interface dynamically loads agent data from the smart contract while maintaining the UI state for filtering and search. Each agent card displays real-time pricing, subscription status, and integration details. The interface responds to wallet connection state and network changes, automatically prompting users to switch networks when needed. A notable technical challenge was managing subscription states across the platform. We implemented a dual-verification system where the frontend checks subscription status before allowing access to agent features, while the smart contract provides the ultimate verification. This ensures both responsive user experience and secure access control. The platform's architecture allows for easy addition of new agents and features. The smart contract includes functions for agent creation and management, while the frontend dynamically renders agent information and capabilities. This modular approach facilitates future expansion of the platform's offerings. Notably hacky solutions include: Using the contract's agent ID as a key for static agent data, allowing us to combine on-chain subscription data with rich UI elements Implementing a custom notification system that works across both blockchain transactions and regular interactions Creating a hybrid pricing system that handles both FLOW and USDT calculations in a single component Leveraging Flow's EVM compatibility made development familiar while gaining the benefits of Flow's infrastructure. The combination of Web3 technologies with modern web development practices resulted in a platform that's both powerful and user-friendly. All code is open source and hosted on GitHub, with detailed documentation for each component. Development followed best practices for smart contract security and frontend performance optimization, creating a foundation for future expansion of the platform. The end result is a seamless integration of blockchain technology, real-time pricing, and user interface design, creating a platform that makes AI agent employment accessible to businesses of all sizes.
summary: EmploAI: A revolutionary platform for hiring, managing, and compensating AI agents. Built with Next.js and Flow blockchain, it enables businesses to seamlessly integrate AI employees into their workforce with transparent pricing and performance tracking.

title: AI Audit
description: Project DescriptionThis AI-driven audit tool offers a thorough and insightful analysis of cryptocurrency projects, empowering investors to make well-informed decisions. By utilizing advanced algorithms, it carefully evaluates multiple key aspects of a project, including its codebase, team background, security protocols, and market performance. The tool then generates a detailed, easy-to-understand report that highlights potential risks and opportunities, giving investors a clear overview of the project's viability and trustworthiness. Whether you're a seasoned investor or a newcomer, this tool simplifies the process of due diligence and enhances your decision-making process.How it's MadeAudit platform uses data from sources such as the Graph, Etherscan, Whitepapers then leverage LLM to make an Analysis. Whitepaper & Smart Contract Data Extraction: The tool analyzes data from the whitepaper and smart contract addresses. Tokenomics/Distribution Analysis: Evaluates the project's token distribution for fairness and sustainability. Smart Contract Breakdown: Explains the functionality of the smart contract in simple terms. Project Summary: Provides a concise summary of the project's purpose and goals. Vulnerability Scan: Scans the code for potential security weaknesses. Red Flags Detection: Flags any unusual or risky aspects of the project. Pool Analysis: Analyzes liquidity pools and token allocation. Regulatory Compliance Check: Assesses whether the project complies with relevant regulations. Competitive Landscape: Analyzes the project‚Äôs competitors and market positioning. Economic Impact & Use Cases: Evaluates real-world applications and economic potential. Risk Scoring: Provides a risk score to help determine the project‚Äôs overall safety and viability.
summary: AI-driven audit tool provides a comprehensive analysis of crypto projects, helping investors make informed decisions. It scans key aspects of the project and delivers a clear, easy-to-understand report.

title: cryptoGUY
description: Project DescriptionCRYPTOGUY is an AI agent chatbot designed for cryptocurrency enthusiasts and traders. It delivers real-time crypto price updates, price alerts for sharp market changes, and breaking news that impacts the crypto industry. The bot also tracks social media trends on Twitter (X) and provides insights from top influencers like CZ, Vitalik, Elon, and Michael Saylor. By integrating with EigenLayer, CRYPTOGUY ensures verifiable AI inferences. The chatbot is deployed on the Coinbase Developer Platform and utilizes AgentKit for staking functionalities.How it's MadeCRYPTOGUY is built using a combination of blockchain and AI-driven technologies. It is deployed on the Coinbase Developer Platform with AgentKit, enabling integration with staking features on Coinbase. The chatbot leverages EigenLayer via the @elizaos/adapter-opacity package, which implements the IVerifiableInferenceAdapter interface to ensure verifiable AI inferences. The system is designed to be highly flexible, supporting multiple AI model providers and allowing future expansion to integrate gateways via CloudFlare. Each request is customizable, and the built-in proof verification ensures transparency and security.
summary: CRYPTOGUY is an AI-powered Telegram chatbot for crypto, offering real-time prices, alerts, news, and trend tracking.

title: HedgeHive
description: Project DescriptionAt the heart of HedgeHive is a peer-to-peer (P2P) order book that enables secure options trading with seamless settlement on 1inch, Opium, and other Arbitrum-powered DEXes‚Äîdelivering fast, cost-efficient transactions. Deribit‚Äôs market data broadens HedgeHive‚Äôs pricing insights, helping the AI-driven agent optimize trades. While most executions follow operator commands, the system also features an autonomous arbitrage engine that instantly capitalizes on profitable order-book spreads in real time. A P2P mesh network built on Kademlia guarantees decentralized order matching, efficient data propagation, and fault tolerance. Communication between agents flows through a Gossip protocol, enabling swift sharing of market data and trade signals‚Äîeliminating any single point of failure. Because HedgeHive functions as a decentralized autonomous network, it never relies on one entity for operation. As long as one node remains active, trading continues uninterrupted‚Äîdelivering resilience, censorship resistance, and a secure trading environment for both seasoned and emerging market participants.How it's MadeHedgeHive is built on ElizaOS, leveraging a decentralized, AI-driven architecture: Autonome serves as the backbone for deploying and running the network‚Äôs AI agents, enabling continuous, autonomous operation and execution of trading strategies. Arbitrum powers all on-chain activities, delivering high-speed, low-cost transactions vital for real-time options settlements and efficient arbitrage. Privy manages user authentication and wallet interactions, streamlining secure onboarding for a seamless trading experience. Lit ensures robust private key security with encryption and access control, safeguarding the network‚Äôs AI agents. Additionally, Goat SDK enables the agent to transact on-chain. We implemented a plugin featuring 1inch and Opium for DEX trading and automated arbitrage, and also developed a Derivatives plugin for Eliza that integrates Deribit as a source for real-time options market data.
summary: HedgeHive features a robust P2P order book and autonomous AI agents for real-time market analysis and arbitrage, utilizing Arbitrum for settlement on DEXes to deliver secure and efficient options trading

title: CarbonX
description: Project DescriptionThe system uses AI agents to plan optimal flight paths, collect emission data, and provide detailed environmental analysis, with results securely stored on Starknet. To provide the feasibility of the solution we have a gazebo simulation which simulates an industry environment. At its core, the system deploys AI-powered drones that autonomously monitor industrial carbon emissions using Covalent's Zero-Employee Enterprise (ZEE) framework to orchestrate intelligent agents for path planning and emission analysis. The system's security and data integrity are maintained through Nillion's SecureVault and NilQB, enabling zero-knowledge verification of drone identities and emission data. Each registered drone collects emission data along AI-optimized flight paths, with the data being securely verifiedHow it's MadeContracts- Deployed on Starknet: The workflow begins with company registration where the smart contract assigns an initial eco_score and token requirements through register_company(). Companies must acquire and maintain the minimum required tokens before proceeding to device registration. Through register_device(), companies register their drones/sensors, where each device receives a cryptographic key pair essential for data authentication. These registered devices must maintain an active status to participate in the emission reporting process. The operational cycle starts with the AI agent determining optimal flight paths, executed through update_flight_path(). As drones collect data along these paths, they sign the emission data with their private keys before submission through submit_report(). The contract verifies the device signature, updates the emission data in CompanyRegistry, and automatically adjusts token requirements - companies with higher emissions must acquire more tokens, while those with lower emissions can sell their excess. This creates a dynamic token economy where companies can trade tokens through transfer(), while the AI continuously updates eco_scores based on compliance and emission patterns. The entire process ensures transparent, verifiable emission monitoring while incentivizing emission reduction through the token mechanism. Nillion: The system leverages Nillion's SecureVault and NilQB to create a zero-trust verification environment for drone agents and emission data. When a company registers a device, the drone's unique identifier and cryptographic credentials are stored in SecureVault, with the company's ownership proof distributed across Nillion's network using secure multiparty computation. This architecture ensures that when drones submit emission reports, the smart contract can verify the device's registration and data integrity through SecureVault lookups, while maintaining data privacy and preventing unauthorized access or tampering. The continuous stream of verifiable data from autonomous drone agents is secured through Nillion's network, enabling trustless validation of emission measurements Covalent: The carbon emission monitoring system leverages Covalent's Zero-Employee Enterprise (ZEE) framework to orchestrate autonomous AI agents in a coordinated workflow. Two primary ZEE workflows drive the system: the Path Planning workflow and the Emission Analysis workflow. The Path Planning workflow combines a Weather Analysis agent and Path Planning agent to determine optimal monitoring coordinates based on weather conditions and geographical constraints. Each agent utilizes specialized tools through ZEE's tool integration system - the Weather agent processes environmental data while the Path Planning agent calculates strategic monitoring points. The Emission Analysis workflow then takes these coordinates and employs an Emission Analysis agent to process sensor data and generate standardized emission scores on a 1-100 scale. These workflows maintain state through ZEE's state management system, allowing for continuous monitoring and updates as conditions change. Through ZEE's orchestration, the agents work in concert to maintain an automated, intelligent monitoring system that requires minimal human intervention while ensuring accurate and consistent emission data collection and analysis.
summary: An intelligent drone-based system that autonomously monitors and analyzes carbon emissions in industrial areas.

title: Based Helper
description: Project Description"AI as the engine, humans as the steering wheel" - Vitalik Leveraging continuous, real-time analysis of live swap data and market movements from Uniswap via The Graph subgraphs, Based Helper fuses AI-powered market insights with automated DeFi trading‚Äîkeeping you in full control while handling the heavy lifting. When you send a command via Twitter, Lens, Discord, or our web app, our AI agent immediately springs into action, ensuring every trade decision is based on the freshest data available. With this approach, the agent is able to dynamically adapt and generate custom interfaces for the user depending on the request and the type of action that the agent cooked up. Here are a few example use cases: "Give me 5 tokens" presents a UI that lets you set the range for token deposition by percentage. "List some rare bored ape close to floor" opens a dedicated view where you can browse and select your preferred NFT. "Deposit ETH into a one sided vault" displays a specialized vault management panel, complete with your vault history. Once the agent has prepared your custom trade order, you have full control over the next step. If you‚Äôre happy with the agent‚Äôs output, simply send ETH directly to the generated Coinbase smart account. Alternatively, you can modify the order using our dynamic interface‚Äîadjusting parameters as needed‚Äîand execute the trade in one seamless transaction. Leveraging paymasters and bundlers to sponsor gas fees, our system efficiently converts your ETH into ERC‚Äë20 tokens while ensuring you remain in control of every decision.How it's MadeBased Helper is built on a robust, multi-layer architecture that interconnects client interfaces, an AI agent, data modules, smart account management, and a dynamic execution layer: Client Interaction: Users send commands via API, Twitter, Lens, or Discord, which are routed to our AI agent. AI Agent & Action Module: Our agent, built on a customized fork of the Eliza framework hosted on Autonome, listens to user inputs and figures out what kind of action the user wants to execute. It extracts as many variables as possible from the input‚Äîsuch as token percentages, NFT search criteria, or vault deposit instructions‚Äîand passes this structured information to the Action Module for order preparation. Data Integration: We continuously analyze real-time swap data and market movements from The Graph, Uniswap, and other trusted sources. This dynamic analysis feeds into our system, ensuring every trade order reflects the latest market conditions. Valuation Engine: Our sophisticated token valuation system employs a comprehensive scoring mechanism that combines traditional metrics like TVL, volume, and net buys with advanced analytics‚Äîincluding smart money momentum and liquidity health. Configurable parameters and risk-adjusted calculations ensure that each trade recommendation is both market-aware and tailored to current conditions. Smart Account Management: When you initiate an order, the system generates a private key and automatically creates a Coinbase smart account. Your order, along with the account‚Äôs public address, is stored and awaits further action. Frontend & On-Chain Integration: Our dynamic user interface is built using Next.js, delivering a responsive and intuitive experience. For on-chain interactions, we integrate with viem and wagmi, ensuring secure and seamless communication withBase mainnet. Trade Execution on Base: Once the agent finalizes your trade order, you have full control over the next step. If you‚Äôre happy with the agent‚Äôs output, simply send ETH directly to the generated Coinbase smart account and it will execute once it receives the funds. Alternatively, you can modify the order using our dynamic interface‚Äîadjusting parameters as needed‚Äîand execute the trade in one seamless transaction. All actions and smart account operations are executed on Base, ensuring that your transactions benefit from a secure, scalable, and efficient environment. Leveraging paymasters and bundlers to sponsor gas fees, our system efficiently converts your ETH into ERC‚Äë20 tokens while ensuring you remain in control of every decision. Dynamic UI Components: The agent‚Äôs output informs our adaptive web interface, which renders the most relevant UI components based on your command. Whether it‚Äôs a percentage selector for token deposits, a dedicated NFT browsing view, or a vault management panel complete with history, our interface adjusts in real time to provide you with a context-sensitive, intuitive experience. This integrated design ensures that while our AI handles complex data analysis, trade preparation, and valuation in real time, you always have the most intuitive, tailored interface at your fingertips‚Äîmaking token trading both efficient and effortless.
summary: Based Helper is an AI-powered DeFi trading assistant that harnesses real-time market data to automate token trades and deliver personalized experiences on Base. Accessible via Twitter, Lens, Discord, or our web app, it adapts its interface in real time to your commands.

title: BullCast
description: Project DescriptionBullCast is an AI-powered financial agent that enables seamless transfers and investments through natural language. This greatly facilitates the onboarding of new users, especially those, who do not have much experience with crypto. They can send funds, manage their portfolio, and place investment orders just by speaking or typing. Beyond transactions, BullCast provides AI-driven market predictions across multiple timeframes (e.g., 1 hour, 1 day). Users can challenge the AI by betting on future prices‚Äîif their prediction is closer to the actual market price than the AI‚Äôs, they win tokens! With intuitive AI assistance, real-time insights, and gamified predictions, BullCast makes finance more accessible, engaging, and rewarding.How it's MadeBullCast is built with a TypeScript-based Express backend, chosen for its scalability, type safety, and strong developer ecosystem. TypeScript ensures a robust API with fewer runtime errors, making it ideal for handling financial transactions and AI interactions. The AI agent is powered by ElizaOS with a custom plugin, allowing natural language processing for seamless transfers and investments. This setup enables users to interact intuitively without complex commands, enhancing accessibility. On the frontend, we use Next.js and React, balancing performance, SEO benefits, and a modern UI/UX. Chakra UI provides a clean, accessible, and customizable component system, streamlining development without sacrificing aesthetics. For deployment, we leverage Docker, ensuring a consistent, containerized environment across different infrastructures. This makes scaling and maintaining BullCast much easier. One particularly notable feature is the market prediction challenge, where users bet against our self-trained and compiled keras prediction model. This gamified approach not only enhances engagement but also tests the AI‚Äôs market modeling in a unique, interactive way.
summary: BullCast is an AI-powered financial agent that lets users make seamless transfers and investments via natural language. It also offers AI-driven market predictions across different timeframes. Users can bet on future prices against the AI‚Äôs prediction, to win tokens! üöÄüí∞

title: Clone
description: Project DescriptionThis no-code agent deployer on Flow lets users create AI-powered Discord and Telegram bots without technical expertise. Using Eliza on Flow, it integrates Pump Flow and VRF for secure execution, while EigenLayer AVSs ensure verifiability and prevent manipulation. Each agent has a Flow smart contract address, guaranteeing transparency. Designed for seamless social integration, these agents automate tasks like moderation, payments, and governance. These bots are decentralized, scalable, and tamper-proof, preventing exploits like the Freysa AI incident. This system enables secure, trustless AI automation for Web3 communities‚Äîno coding required.How it's MadeWe leverage: üîπ Eliza on Flow Kit ‚Äì Provides a seamless framework for deploying and managing onchain agents. We've added two functionalities to it. Pump.Flow Actions VRF Action üîπ Warden Agent Kit ‚Äì Enables cross-chain execution, so agents can interact across different ecosystems. Deposit to Lending Pools üîπ Orderbook Smart Contract (on Warden) ‚Äì Optimizes execution by tracking liquidity and automatically allocating funds to the best yield pools. CA: 0xf3451c19a70852533c3416e76e229e15166d5f33 üîπ EigenLayer AVS ‚Äì Ensures agents are fully verifiable, making them truly Level - 1 AI agents by validating both actions and data sources. Verify Data Source üîπ Digital Ocean and Telegram API for Agent Deployments With one-click deployment, agents can go live on Telegram instantly, interact in real time, and execute onchain actions seamlessly. The result? Truly L1-native, verifiable onchain AI agents‚Äîwithout writing a single line of code.
summary: A no-code agent deployer for normies that abstracts away tech by integrating a bot into telegram in a single click.

title: Mike
description: Project DescriptionMike is an advanced AI Legal Agent that combines the capabilities of large language models with secure data handling through Nillion's decentralized database (nilDB). The agent embodies the persona of a brilliant legal professional with an eidetic memory, capable of handling complex legal queries while maintaining strict confidentiality of sensitive information. It's designed to provide legal insights, manage secure data storage, execute trades and make due diligence on crypto projects, as well as interact through multiple channels including Telegram, WhatsApp and Twitter (yapping for now). Key features: -Secure secret storage using Nillion's MPC-based database -Multi-channel communication (Telegram, WhatsApp, Twitter) -Legal precedent citation and analysis -EVM blockchain integration for Base and Ethereum networks -NEAR blockchain integration -Image generation capabilitiesHow it's MadeThe project is built using a modular plugin architecture that combines several key technologies: A. Core Agent Framework: -Built on ElizaOS framework -Uses Anthropic's language model for primary intelligence -Implements a plugin system for extensible functionality B. Secure Data Handling: -Integrates Nillion's nilDB for secure data storage using Multi-Party Computation (MPC) -Implements secure secret sharing across distributed nodes C. Plugin Architecture: Modular design with plugins for different functionalities: @elizaos/plugin-bootstrap: Core functionality @elizaos/plugin-image-generation: AI image generation @elizaos/plugin-evm: Ethereum Virtual Machine integration @elizaos/plugin-near: NEAR blockchain integration @elizaos/plugin-whatsapp: WhatsApp communication @elizaos/plugin-agentkit: Coinbase Developer Platform integration @elizaos/plugin-nillion: Secure data storage @elizaos/plugin-chainbase: Blockchain data integration D. Security Features: -Environment-based configuration for sensitive credentials -Secure secret management through Nillion's MPC The project leverages Nillion's innovative MPC technology to ensure that sensitive legal information and secrets are stored securely across distributed nodes, where no single node can access the complete information. This makes it particularly suitable for handling confidential legal data while maintaining the accessibility needed for an AI agent to function effectively. The character configuration is carefully crafted to embody a ("wannabe") legal professional's persona, complete with specific action patterns and response styles that maintain (semi)professionalism while delivering accurate legal insights.
summary: An AI Legal Agent for lawyers, companies, and individuals, to onboard, trade, and provide general advice and due diligence on crypto projects.

title: artistmanager
description: Project DescriptionWe are building a tool for artists by artists. Independent artists already wear too many hats. Let's take some off by democratizing artist management. But instead of taking a percentage, it creates them and distributes them to your supporters/fans/community. Effortlessly creating and managing tokens, onchain media, content storage, content distribution, engagement, social media insights and accountability and more.How it's MadeI built this project using CDP AgentKit, Cursor and a few ElizaOS packages to help with telegram bot integration, social integrations and database integration. CDP agentkit gave me a great base / boilerplate for then customizing and building an ai agent for music management. Base gave me a great foundation for integrating wallet functions/ token capabilities into the agent as well. I stayed up until 7am one night to code the bulk of the project! And then spent the next few days testing and working out the details. It‚Äôs made from own experiences being an artist with the functions that I know artists and independent creators struggle with and could use help with. A lot of us seek managers but if you‚Äôre small it‚Äôs very hard to find someone who is reliable and willing to work with you and who sees your vision/goals and truly believes in them. So we end up doing everything ourselves and becoming our own bottlenecks. So really, I built this from my own problems and frustrations and found a way to piece together different methods and technologies to build this.
summary: Every artist should have a manager. Bringing AI-powered managers to every independent musican

title: shortify
description: Project DescriptionShortify is a smart news platform designed to provide quick and digestible summaries of lengthy news articles. By condensing complex stories into short, easy-to-read formats, Shortify helps users stay updated without spending too much time reading. Whether it's breaking news, global events, or industry insights, Shortify ensures you get the key points in seconds.How it's MadeShortify is developed using Next.js for a seamless and efficient user experience. It leverages the Flow blockchain for secure and transparent news verification. To simplify the user onboarding process, we use Privy Wallet as a server wallet, abstracting the complexity of wallet creation from users. For news summarization, Shortify integrates AI agents with advanced NLP to generate concise and accurate summaries. Additionally, these agents assign a confidence score to each news article. Only articles that meet a certain confidence threshold are published, ensuring credibility and reliability. This combination of blockchain, AI-driven summarization, and confidence scoring creates a trustworthy and efficient platform for consuming news quickly.
summary: Shortify delivers concise news summaries, making it easy to stay informed in less time.

Made a custom plugin for the arbitrum blockchain so every developer has a starting point for making any onchain agent on arbitrum blbockchain. Sponsers - Arbitrum, Gaianet, EigenLayerHow it's MadeAn AI Agent which is capable of doing every onchain task on Arbitrum and Arbitrum Sepolia blockchain just by giving prompt. Made a custom plugin for the arbitrum blockchain so every developer has a starting point for making any onchain agent on arbitrum blbockchain. Sponsers - Arbitrum, Gaianet, EigenLayer

title: pulse
description: Project Descriptionintelligent, event-driven ecosystem designed to transform how people discover, engage with, and navigate live music event, seamlessly blending real-time data, personalized recommendations, blockchain-enabled transactions, and autonomous systems, acting as your ultimate digital companion for live experiencesHow it's MadePersonalized Event Discovery: Integrates with Spotify, SoundCloud, and other music platforms to analyze user listening habits. Recommends events based on musical preferences, social trends, and location data. AI-curated ‚ÄúPulse Picks‚Äù for spontaneous, high-energy experiences. On-Chain Payment System: Users can pay for event tickets, rides (Uber), and even in-event purchases using crypto (BTC, ETH, USDC, USDT, GHO, AAVE). A small service fee (+5%) on rides and transactions when using crypto, processed seamlessly. Integrated Mobility (Uber API): Request rides directly through Pulse with the option to connect existing Uber accounts or pay on-chain. Real-time ride tracking and estimated costs, with dynamic surge pricing notifications. Social Sync: Connect with friends attending the same events. Group planning features with synced schedules, ride-sharing coordination, and live location sharing. Dynamic Event Companion: Provides real-time updates on event schedules, artist lineups, and venue maps. Crowd density tracking to identify less crowded areas for food, drinks, or better views. Live notifications for spontaneous after-parties, secret sets, and surprise performances. Loyalty & Rewards: On-chain collectibles and digital badges for attending events, redeemable for discounts, exclusive merch, or early access to tickets. Autonomous Financial Layer: Smart wallets powered by AgentKit for secure transactions and on-chain automation. Manages real-time crypto-to-fiat conversions where needed for merchant settlements.
summary: Seamless Web3-Powered Event Curation, Ride Coordination, and On-Chain Payments for Music Festivals & Club Events

title: HelenusAI
description: Project DescriptionFull Explanation of the Architecture and Lifecycle This diagram outlines the complete flow from when a user interacts with the trading form to the ongoing monitoring of the strategy. Below is an explanation of each major step: Frontend Flow User Interaction: The user accesses the Trading Page using the ETH Loop Form. WebSocket Setup: The frontend establishes a WebSocket connection to the backend. Sending Strategy Selection: Once connected, the frontend sends a strategy_select message containing the necessary strategy parameters (such as collateral amounts, leverage, target APY, etc.). Backend WebSocket Connection and Authentication Message Reception: The backend's WebSocket endpoint (defined in the router/routes) receives the incoming message. Authentication: The connection is authenticated using the ws_auth middleware, ensuring only authorized users can proceed. Processing Strategy Selection Message Handling: After authentication, the message is forwarded to the WebSocketService.handle_message function, which determines the message type. Strategy Processing: If the message is a strategy_select type, the system triggers the process_strategy_selection function. This function: Calls VaultService.create_vault to create a new vault record and persists it in the database. Checks if the agent wallet data is provided: If not provided, it automatically creates an agent wallet using WalletService.create_agent_wallet. If provided, it uses the available wallet data to continue the strategy setup. Agent Initialization and Monitoring Agent Setup: Using the available wallet data, the system initializes an agent via AgentManager.add_agent and links it to the newly created vault. Monitoring Start: The monitoring process is started with StrategyMonitor.start_monitoring, which sends periodic monitor_update messages with key performance metrics to the frontend. Initialization Response: After all steps complete, a strategy_init message containing vault details (such as the vault ID, deposit address, and further instructions) is returned to the frontend. Frontend Receives Initialization UI Update: The frontend updates the user interface to display the vault information and instructions for funding the agent wallet, based on the received strategy_init message. Deposit Process After Funding the Agent Wallet Funding the Wallet: The user funds the agent wallet with gas. Deposit Action: The user then clicks the deposit button, which sends a deposit message through the established WebSocket connection. Deposit Handling: The deposit message is processed by the WebSocketService.handle_message. For a message of type deposit: The system invokes process_deposit in the WebSocketService. The VaultService.handle_deposit function is called to deploy the vault contract if needed and update the vault balance in the database. Completion Response: A deposit_complete message is returned to indicate that the deposit process has been successfully completed, and this response is sent back to the frontend. Frontend Update: The frontend displays a confirmation message indicating that the deposit is complete. Ongoing Monitoring Live Updates: The monitoring service continuously sends monitor_update messages, providing real-time updates on position metrics and strategy performance to the frontend.How it's MadeTechnologies Used Backend Frameworks and Libraries: Python: The core language used for implementing business logic, agents, and real-time services. FastAPI: Provides a fast, asynchronous web framework for RESTful API development. Pydantic: Used for data validation and schema definitions. Motor: An asynchronous MongoDB driver for non-blocking database operations. Asyncio: Fundamental for asynchronous execution across service layers. Web3 & CDP Libraries: For blockchain interactions and wallet management, integrating with DeFi protocols. Frontend Frameworks and Libraries: Next.js & React: For building modern, server-side rendered, and highly interactive web applications. TypeScript: Provides strong typing for robust and maintainable frontend code. Recharts: For producing responsive data visualization components. Next.js Routing & Server Components: Enhance performance and modular page management. Real-Time and Communication Technologies: WebSockets: Enable real-time data push and two-way communication between the backend and the frontend, essential for live market updates and risk alerts. Miscellaneous Libraries: UUID Generation, Data Streaming Handlers, etc.: These utilities enhance the system‚Äôs ability to track sessions, handle dynamic data flows, and integrate smoothly across both frontend and backend systems.
summary: This project is an advanced AI agent that autonomously analyzes real-time market data to dynamically optimize trading strategies.

title: aether
description: Project DescriptionAether is an AI-powered crypto onboarding assistant designed to make getting started with Web3 effortless and accessible. Inspired by the viral trend of people onboarding strangers to crypto on the streets, Aether brings that same simplicity and human connection to the digital space. The flow starts with someone who already has crypto sending funds to a new user‚Äôs email address. The recipient doesn‚Äôt need any prior blockchain knowledge‚Äîthey simply log in, and Aether guides them through setting up their wallet, creating a basename (a human-friendly identifier to replace complex addresses), and exploring essential onchain activities like sending transactions, checking balances, and interacting with decentralized applications (dApps). Aether offers clear, non-technical explanations at every step, making the process smooth for beginners while still being useful for experienced users. By combining conversational AI with blockchain functionality, Aether transforms the onboarding experience into something intuitive, engaging, and fun‚Äîbringing the street-level onboarding vibe to everyone, everywhere.How it's MadeAether is built using Coinbase's AgentKit as the AI chatbot backend, enabling smooth onchain interactions and conversational guidance. The frontend is developed with Next.js, offering a responsive and intuitive user interface for seamless communication with the agent. For wallet management, Privy server wallets allow users to sign in with their email, enabling the agent to interact with the user‚Äôs server wallet and perform transactions on their behalf‚Äîno manual signing required. This makes it easy for new users to engage with crypto without dealing with private keys or wallet extensions. Nillion's Secret Vaults are integrated to securely store and manage sensitive conversation data, ensuring user interactions remain private and protected. This privacy-preserving approach adds an extra layer of trust and security to the onboarding process. A particularly notable feature is the email-to-wallet onboarding flow: existing crypto users can send funds to a friend‚Äôs email. When the recipient logs in, Aether uses their server wallet to guide them through creating a basename and performing their first transactions, simplifying the onboarding process. By combining these technologies, Aether delivers a secure, intuitive, and engaging experience that bridges the gap between Web2 familiarity and Web3 innovation. One of the more challenging aspects of building Aether was designing the prompting system for the AI agent. Unlike typical AI interactions where the user guides the agent, Aether flips the dynamic‚Äîthe agent leads the user through onboarding and onchain activities. Crafting prompts that kept the agent on-task while maintaining a natural, conversational tone was tricky, and despite multiple iterations, the agent still occasionally goes off-script or behaves unpredictably. Balancing guidance and flexibility remains an ongoing challenge, but it‚Äôs part of what makes developing with AI so interesting.
summary: Aether is an AI-powered crypto assistant that makes onboarding to Web3 effortless. Create basenames, send transactions, and explore dApps with easy, conversational guidance

title: AgentStrategy
description: Project DescriptionOne agent is designed to analyze the top 100 AI agent tokens on Base. Every minute, it randomly selects one token and generates a detailed analysis report. The report covers social metrics such as Twitter mindshare momentum, engagement quality, and sentiment analysis. On the technical side, it evaluates price action, trading volume, and market structure. Each report also includes a buy, hold, or sell recommendation, along with a conviction level and suggested time horizon. The trader agent is responsible for actively trading the top 100 AI agent tokens on Base. Every five minutes, it reviews insights from the analyst agent and determines whether to execute a trade. It factors in current holdings and market conditions to make the most strategic decision at the time. The influencer agent monitors the latest reports and trade activity, crafting the most engaging tweet possible every hour. Over time, cookie data will be fed back into the LLMs to refine future tweets, optimizing for increased mindshare and engagement. AgentStrategy will eventually accept LPs and aims to be the world's largest agent investment fund.How it's MadeThis project integrates several technologies to create a cohesive system for analyzing and trading AI agent tokens. It starts with the Cookie.fun API, which provides real-time data on AI agent tokens. In parallel, the system pulls relevant data from X (formerly Twitter) posts about each token to capture social sentiment and engagement metrics. All data is processed and analyzed using OpenAI‚Äôs LLMs to generate a comprehensive investment analysis for one token every minute. The analysis is stored in Supabase, which serves as a centralized database for the agent network. A second agent retrieves the analyst data from Supabase and leverages OpenAI to make trading decisions based on the latest insights. These decisions are executed automatically through Coinbase AgentKit, enabling seamless onchain trades. Notably, combining social sentiment analysis with real-time trading decisions creates a self-reinforcing feedback loop. This dynamic system is still evolving, but the modular architecture ensures it can improve and scale over time.
summary: AgentStrategy is a swarm of autonomous AI agents that analyze, trade, and promote a portfolio of AI agent tokens.

title: aevia
description: Project DescriptionAevia is the first AI agent dedicated to securing your digital legacy. She will periodically check in to ensure you're okay. If something happens to you, she will know and take action to fulfill your final wishes‚Äîwhether it's sending a message to a friend, transferring crypto to a loved one, or gifting your favorite NFTs to a digital friend you've never met in person. We want to make securing your digital legacy incredibly easy, safe, and functional‚Äîso that anyone can set it up in just 5 minutes. How does it work? We connect with Aevia and choose what we want our legacy to be. Then, Aevia will periodically contact us via Telegram to check on us. If we stop responding for a certain period, Aevia will reach out to our emergency contacts and try to find out what happened. If they confirm that something bad has happened and we have passed away, Aevia will contact our beneficiary, inform them of what happened, and execute our wishes‚Äîfor example, by triggering the smart contract for fund transfer. Fund Transfer: The fund transfer process is secure. The user does not need to send their funds to any contract. They only need to do two things: Approve the Aevia contract to withdraw the amount of funds they wish to leave as a legacy. Sign a message requested by the system. This message uses ERC-712, allowing the user to see the data they are signing. The signature is stored off-chain and will be used to withdraw the funds if necessary. The specified funds can only be sent to the wallet that the user signed. Future Roadmap: We want to add more features, such as NFT transfers, key transfers from different platforms through NFT association, and a final social media post. Aevia could compose a farewell message on behalf of the user. We believe that many opportunities arise from AI-managed digital legacies.How it's MadeThis project was born from the idea of having a life safeguard in case something happened to you. Initially, Aevia was supposed to search newspapers and news sources to check if something had happened, but we opted for a simpler approach a periodic keepalive check with the user. If they stop responding, Aevia can reach out to one or two emergency contacts to verify if something happened. The initial frontend was built using V0, with AI-assisted design. Later, we integrated it with Tailwind UI to have more control over the interface. Regarding the blockchain component, we wanted to provide a solution where users don‚Äôt have to trust us but rather rely on the smart contract to allow future fund transfers. The advantage of this approach is that we can only move the exact amount of funds from A to B that the user authorized. To achieve this, we developed a smart contract utilizing the ERC-712 standard. The user signs a message containing the transaction details, and the contract verifies that the submitted transaction data matches the user‚Äôs signature. If any value differs, the transaction is rejected. The execution of the legacy is restricted to wallets with the operator role. As for the agent, its iterations follow a well-defined structure, similar to a standard bot. However, its interactions with the user leverage the capabilities of the LLM agent, particularly in how it investigates emergency contacts to determine what happened to the user. In the future, we aim to enhance this aspect and introduce new interaction dynamics. One particular challenge was that the agent needed to initiate conversations via Telegram with users it had never contacted before, which a traditional bot cannot do. To solve this, we adapted the Telethon API in Python to better handle messaging, and the results were very effective. Additionally, we had to use a dedicated phone line for Aevia.
summary: Aevia is the first AI agent securing your digital legacy. She checks in to ensure you're okay, and if something happens, she fulfills your final wishes‚Äîsending messages, transferring crypto, or gifting NFTs. Simple, safe, and functional‚Äîset it up in just few minutes!

title: GuardianScope
description: Project DescriptionGuardianScope is an innovative, decentralized content moderation protocol designed to address the growing need for fair, transparent, and efficient content moderation in Web3 and decentralized social platforms. Built on EigenLayer's Actively Validated Service (AVS) infrastructure, GuardianScope leverages AI-powered agents and blockchain technology to provide automated, unbiased, and privacy-preserving content moderation. Core Problem Addressed Traditional content moderation systems are often centralized, prone to bias, and lack transparency. These systems can be easily manipulated or censored, leading to unfair outcomes and a lack of trust among users. GuardianScope aims to solve these issues by decentralizing the moderation process, ensuring that decisions are made transparently and fairly, while preserving user privacy. How It Works GuardianScope operates as a decentralized network of AI-powered operators who analyze and moderate content submitted by users or platforms. The protocol uses EigenLayer's restaking mechanism to secure the network, ensuring that operators are economically incentivized to act honestly and efficiently. The moderation process is powered by advanced AI models capable of analyzing multi-modal content (text, images, and videos) in real-time. Key Components: Decentralized Moderation Network: A distributed network of operators runs AI agents to analyze content. Operators are staked and incentivized through EigenLayer's restaking mechanism, ensuring economic security and honest behavior. The decision-making process is transparent and recorded on-chain, making it immune to centralized control or censorship. AI-Powered Analysis: The protocol supports multi-modal content analysis, including text, images, and videos. AI models, such as NLP (Natural Language Processing) for text and computer vision for images/videos, are used to evaluate content. The system is adaptable to platform-specific moderation requirements and continuously improves through decentralized governance. Smart Contract Infrastructure: GuardianScope uses AVS smart contracts to coordinate moderation tasks, verify on-chain results, and distribute rewards. The contracts ensure transparency and fairness by recording moderation decisions and operator actions on the blockchain. EigenLayer Integration: GuardianScope integrates with EigenLayer's AVS infrastructure, leveraging BLS signatures for efficient consensus and restaking for economic security. Operators who act maliciously or fail to perform their duties can be slashed, ensuring the integrity of the network. User Flow A content publisher submits content for moderation through the GuardianScope contract. The GuardianScope contract emits a NewTaskCreated event, signaling a new moderation request. Staked operators receive the request and process it using their AI models. Each operator generates a moderation decision (approve/reject), hashes it with the content, and signs the hash. Operators submit their signed decisions back to the GuardianScope contract. The contract verifies the operators' eligibility and stake before accepting the submission, ensuring only valid and staked operators can participate. Technical Components Smart Contracts: The backbone of the protocol, handling task coordination, result verification, and reward distribution. EigenLayer AVS: Provides the infrastructure for secure and efficient consensus among operators. AI Agent System: Modular and extensible, supporting multiple AI models for different types of content analysis. Local Development and Testing GuardianScope is designed to be easily deployable for local development and testing. The project provides detailed instructions for setting up a local Anvil chain (Ethereum testnet), deploying the necessary contracts, and running the AI-powered operator application. Developers can test the moderation process by submitting content and observing how the AI agents and smart contracts handle the moderation tasks. Future Plans Testnet Deployment: Support for testnet deployments will be added soon, allowing developers to test the protocol in a more realistic environment. BLS Signature Architecture: Future updates will migrate to a more efficient BLS signature architecture for improved scalability and security. Production Readiness: The protocol is currently intended for local development, but plans are in place to make it production-ready for decentralized platforms. Why GuardianScope? GuardianScope is a pioneering solution for decentralized content moderation, combining the power of AI with the transparency and security of blockchain technology. It is designed to empower Web3 platforms with a fair, unbiased, and efficient moderation system that aligns with the principles of decentralization and user sovereignty.How it's MadeHow GuardianScope Was Built: The Corrected Details GuardianScope is a decentralized content moderation protocol built on EigenLayer's Actively Validated Service (AVS) infrastructure. It uses OpenAI's API for AI-powered content analysis and is implemented entirely in Node.js for the backend. The project was developed using the AVS HelloWorld template as a starting point, which provided a solid foundation for building a decentralized service on EigenLayer. Core Technologies Used Blockchain Infrastructure: EigenLayer AVS: GuardianScope is built on EigenLayer's AVS infrastructure, which provides the decentralized coordination and security layer for the protocol. AVS HelloWorld Template: The project started with the AVS HelloWorld template, which provided the basic structure for implementing an AVS, including task coordination, operator management, and reward distribution. Foundry: Used for smart contract development, testing, and deployment. Foundry's Forge and Cast tools were used to write and test the smart contracts. Anvil: A local Ethereum testnet provided by Foundry, used for local development and testing. AI-Powered Content Analysis: OpenAI API: Instead of building custom AI models, GuardianScope leverages OpenAI's API for content analysis. This includes text moderation using OpenAI's advanced NLP models (e.g., GPT-4) for detecting inappropriate or harmful content. Node.js Integration: The OpenAI API is called directly from the Node.js backend, eliminating the need for Python or other AI frameworks. The backend handles the API requests and processes the moderation results. Backend and Frontend: Node.js: The entire backend, including the operator application and contract interaction logic, is built using Node.js. This includes handling moderation tasks, calling the OpenAI API, and interacting with the blockchain. ethers.js: Used for interacting with Ethereum smart contracts from the Node.js backend. TypeScript: The backend code is written in TypeScript, providing type safety and better developer experience. Development Environment: Nix: For reproducible development environments, Nix was used to manage dependencies and ensure consistency across different setups. Docker: Optional containerization for deploying the backend services in a scalable manner. How Everything Fits Together Smart Contract Infrastructure The smart contracts are based on the AVS HelloWorld template, which provides the basic structure for task coordination, operator management, and reward distribution. The contracts were extended to support content moderation tasks and integrate with the OpenAI API. Task Coordination: The smart contracts handle the creation of moderation tasks, assignment to operators, and verification of results. On-Chain Verification: Operators submit their moderation decisions (approve/reject) along with a hash of the content and their signature. The contract verifies the signature and ensures the operator is staked and eligible to participate. Reward Distribution: Operators are rewarded for their work through EigenLayer's restaking mechanism, with rewards distributed transparently on-chain. EigenLayer Integration GuardianScope integrates with EigenLayer's AVS infrastructure, which provides the security and coordination layer for the decentralized network of operators. ServiceManagerBase: GuardianScope implements EigenLayer's ServiceManagerBase contract to handle task coordination and signature aggregation. BLS Signatures: Operators use BLS signatures to sign their moderation decisions, which are then aggregated for efficient on-chain verification. Slashing Conditions: Malicious or non-performing operators can be slashed, ensuring the network's integrity and security. AI-Powered Content Analysis Instead of building custom AI models, GuardianScope uses OpenAI's API for content analysis. The Node.js backend handles the API calls and processes the moderation results. OpenAI API Integration: The backend sends content to the OpenAI API for analysis and receives moderation decisions (e.g., approve/reject) based on the API's response. Real-Time Analysis: The OpenAI API provides real-time moderation capabilities, ensuring quick turnaround times for moderation tasks. Privacy-Preserving: While the content is sent to OpenAI for analysis, the system ensures that sensitive data is handled securely and in compliance with privacy regulations. Development Process Local Devnet Deployment To make development and testing easier, GuardianScope provides a local devnet setup using Foundry's Anvil chain. Here's how it works: Start Anvil Chain: A local Ethereum testnet is started using Anvil, providing a sandbox environment for testing. Deploy Contracts: The EigenLayer core contracts and GuardianScope AVS contracts are deployed to the local chain. Start Operator: The Node.js backend (operator application) is started, connecting to the local chain and listening for moderation tasks. Test Moderation: Developers can submit test content for moderation and observe how the system processes it using the OpenAI API. Testing GuardianScope includes comprehensive tests for both the smart contracts and the backend logic. The tests are written in Solidity (for smart contracts) and TypeScript (for backend logic), ensuring that the system behaves as expected under various conditions. Hacky or Notable Solutions OpenAI API Integration: Instead of building custom AI models, GuardianScope leverages OpenAI's API for content analysis. This significantly reduced development time and allowed us to focus on the decentralized infrastructure. The Node.js backend handles all API calls, making the system lightweight and easy to maintain. AVS HelloWorld Template: Using the AVS HelloWorld template as a starting point allowed us to quickly build the core functionality of GuardianScope. The template provided the basic structure for task coordination, operator management, and reward distribution, which we extended to support content moderation. Node.js Backend: The entire backend is implemented in Node.js, including the operator application and OpenAI API integration. This simplified the development process and eliminated the need for additional languages like Python. Partner Technologies and Their Benefits EigenLayer: EigenLayer's restaking mechanism and AVS infrastructure were critical to GuardianScope's security and scalability. By leveraging EigenLayer, we were able to build a decentralized network of operators with strong economic incentives to act honestly. OpenAI API: Using OpenAI's API for content analysis allowed us to quickly implement advanced AI capabilities without building custom models. This saved significant development time and provided access to state-of-the-art NLP models. Foundry: Foundry's Forge and Cast tools made smart contract development and testing much faster and more efficient. The ability to write tests in Solidity and deploy contracts locally with Anvil streamlined the development process. Conclusion GuardianScope is a powerful decentralized content moderation protocol built on EigenLayer's AVS infrastructure and powered by OpenAI's API. By leveraging the AVS HelloWorld template and implementing the backend entirely in Node.js, we were able to create a lightweight, efficient, and scalable system. The integration with OpenAI provides advanced AI capabilities, while EigenLayer ensures the security and decentralization of the network. This combination makes GuardianScope a robust solution for Web3 platforms seeking fair and efficient content moderation. operator is on rust. Thank you for the additional clarification! With the operator implemented in Rust, the architecture of GuardianScope becomes even more interesting. Let‚Äôs revise the explanation to reflect this key detail and provide a more accurate description of how the project was built. title: RexDeus
description: Project DescriptionOur project proposes a new industry standard for seamlessly integrating AI into Unreal Engine, enabling sophisticated AI Agents to function as dynamic NPCs within game environments. We aim to develop an Unreal Engine plugin that acts as a client capable of interfacing with any Unreal Engine project.
