The core objective is to empower AI agents with advanced behavior, ranging from interaction with players to autonomous decision-making, ultimately enhancing gaming ecosystems by mitigating issues like cheating and exploitative tactics. This initiative introduces two core AI components: Mother AI and Baby AI. Mother AI: The central authority controlling the game's procedural elements, such as time cycles, difficulty, item generation, and weather. It governs Baby AI while maintaining distinct data sets for global control. Baby AI: These are the interactive NPCs with individual memory, statistics, and emotional traits. They can serve various roles‚Äîcompanions, merchants, or adversaries. Players can engage with Baby AI in numerous ways, including forming alliances or rivalries, acquiring game items, and negotiating in-game strategies.How it's MadeOur project leverages several key technologies to build an advanced AI integration for Unreal Engine: Unreal Engine: We are developing a plugin to integrate AI agents as NPCs directly into the game environment. This plugin facilitates real‚Äëtime communication between the AI agents and Unreal projects. AgentKit: We use AgentKit to develop and manage our AI agents, giving each agent a programmable on‚Äëchain wallet and a suite of blockchain actions (such as NFT minting). This allows each agent to have its own unique attributes‚Äîincluding memory, emotional traits, and behaviors‚Äîwithout needing to reinvent blockchain interactions. OpenAI LLM Model: The OpenAI large language model interprets player input, transforming natural language into structured commands. This enables dynamic, context‚Äëaware conversations with the AI agents, allowing NPCs to respond adaptively and offer in‚Äëgame advice or challenges. EigenLayer: We integrate EigenLayer to secure and validate our on‚Äëchain operations. Instead of relying solely on restaking, our AI agents (or their associated wallets) are automatically registered as operators on EigenLayer. This process provides decentralized economic security and trust by ensuring that every smart NPC‚Äôs on‚Äëchain identity is verified by a network of trusted operators. Autonome: Autonome hosts our fully integrated AI agent solution, providing production‚Äëready infrastructure with TEE plug‚Äëins for verifiability and enhanced security. It enables seamless management and scaling of multiple agents and their interactions within the gaming ecosystem.
summary: AI Agent for Unreal Engine! Our plugin powers dynamic NPCs using OpenAI, AgentKit, and Autonom, enabling real-time player interaction, game world control, and enhanced immersion.

title: BasevenueWolf
description: Project DescriptionProblems We Solve Web2 Game developers would like to migrate to Web3 (NFTs, tokens, in-game items, subscriptions, etc.), but handling the migration is complex, expensive and challenging. Development ‚Äì Web2 developers often lack experience with smart contracts, blockchain SDKs, and decentralized architectures, making it difficult to transition smoothly . Tokeneconomics - Designing sustainable token models, ensuring liquidity, and managing inflationary/deflationary mechanisms require expertise in blockchain economics. Payment Integrations - Enabling seamless crypto and fiat payment options for game users, integrating wallets, and ensuring regulatory compliance can be challenging. (TODO: We will solve this problem with our Paywall Integration feature). Our Solution: We provide AI Agent Platform and SDK to Mobile Developers to create their Tokens and Products. Then, Developers will be able to manage their in game assets and easily integrate it with their game by using our BasevenueWolf and BasevenueWolf SDK. In the platform we are using customised AgentKit Action Providers in order to handle token, nft deployments. https://github.com/berkingurcan/BasevenueWolf https://github.com/batuhanozcan1605/basevenue_wolf https://github.com/batuhanozcan1605/basevenuewolf_sdkHow it's Made Core Technologies: Frontend: Built with Flutter: https://github.com/batuhanozcan1605/basevenue_wolf Smart Contracts: Solidity with Hardhat for development and deployment AI Integration: Leverages CDP Agentkit for AI capabilities Blockchain: Deployed on Base Sepolia Testnet State Management: Redis for caching and state persistence Notable Technical Components: Smart Contract Architecture: Custom ERC20 tokens for game currencies ERC721 (GameItem) for NFT-based game items Specialized deployer contracts for each token type Uses OpenZeppelin contracts for security and standardization AI Agent System: Implements Coinbase's AgentKit for AI-powered management Two main AI providers: TokenManagerProvider: Handles game currency deployment and management ProductManagerProvider: Manages game items and products Uses LangChain for complex AI workflows Backend Infrastructure: API Routes built with Next.js Redis integration for caching and data persistence Streaming responses for real-time AI interactions Viem for Ethereum interactions Hacky Things The TokenManagerProvider and ProductManagerProvider implementation includes a hacky way of deploying contracts by using AI Agents and storing token-to-wallet mappings in Redis, allowing for quick lookups without on-chain queries. Sponsor Technologies: Coinbase AgentKit Base
summary: üöÄ BasevenueWolf is the blockchain and AI-powered alternative to RevenueCat, bringing seamless, transparent, and trustless product management to Web3 Applications.

title: WeAi
description: Project DescriptionProject Goal: The primary goal of the Week in Ethereum News AI Edition project is to create a next-generation, AI-powered newsletter that continues the legacy of the original "Week in Ethereum News" while addressing the critical need for trust and transparency in AI-generated content. We aim to achieve this by implementing Verifiable Agent Prompts using EigenLayer's Autonomous Verifiable Services (AVS). Problem Statement: As AI agents become increasingly sophisticated and are used for content creation, concerns about their trustworthiness, potential biases, and lack of transparency are growing. In the context of news dissemination, it is crucial to ensure that AI-generated newsletters are not only informative but also created under sound, auditable, and policy-compliant instructions. Traditional AI systems often operate as "black boxes," making it difficult to verify their processes and outputs. Solution Overview: Verifiable Agent Prompts Our project addresses this challenge by introducing Verifiable Agent Prompts. We leverage EigenLayer AVS to create a system where: ‚Ä¢ The instructions (prompts) given to our AI newsletter generation agent are explicitly defined and recorded on the Ethereum blockchain. ‚Ä¢ A decentralized network of Agentic Operators (simulated in our Proof of Concept) automatically reviews and verifies these prompts based on predefined Verification Policies. ‚Ä¢ The verification outcome (Approved or Rejected) is cryptographically secured and recorded on the blockchain, providing an auditable and tamper-proof record of the prompt verification process. ‚Ä¢ The AI newsletter generation agent is conditionally executed ‚Äì it only proceeds to create the newsletter content if its prompt has been verifiably approved by the operator network. This approach aims to build a more trustworthy and transparent AI-driven newsletter by ensuring that the AI's content generation is guided by instructions that have been verifiably reviewed and validated by a decentralized network, enhancing user confidence and accountability. Key Features and Components: 1 Autogen Agentic Workflow for Newsletter Generation: ‚Ä¢ We utilize the Autogen framework to create a multi-agent system for automated newsletter creation. This system includes specialized agents such as: ‚Ä¢ Manager Agent: The central orchestrator, responsible for planning the newsletter content, delegating tasks, and managing the overall workflow. ‚Ä¢ Critic Agent: Reviews plans and generated content, providing feedback to ensure quality, accuracy, and completeness. ‚Ä¢ Web Scraper Agent: Gathers relevant information from the web based on prompts and instructions, extracting data from news sources and online resources. ‚Ä¢ Coder Agent: (Placeholder for future development) Intended for data analysis and code-assisted content generation. ‚Ä¢ Telegram Poster Agent: Automates the distribution of the generated newsletter to a Telegram channel. ‚Ä¢ Twitter Poster Agent: (Commented out for now) Intended for future automated posting to Twitter. 2 EigenLayer AVS Integration for Verifiable Prompts: ‚Ä¢ We integrate with EigenLayer AVS to implement the Verifiable Agent Prompts mechanism. This involves: ‚Ä¢ Solidity Smart Contracts (NewsletterPromptTaskManager.sol, NewsletterPromptServiceManager.sol): Deployed as an EigenLayer AVS, these contracts manage the prompt verification tasks, record verification outcomes, and interact with the EigenLayer ecosystem. ‚Ä¢ Aggregator (aggregator.py): An off-chain component responsible for: ‚Ä¢ Submitting new prompt verification tasks to the AVS contract. ‚Ä¢ Receiving and aggregating signed verdicts from Agentic Operators. ‚Ä¢ Determining the overall verification outcome. ‚Ä¢ Recording the outcome on the AVS contract. ‚Ä¢ Agentic Operators (Simulated by prompt_operator.py): Represent a network of entities that participate in the AVS and perform prompt verification. In our PoC, these are simulated by running prompt_operator.py. ‚Ä¢ Verification Agents (within Operators): Specialized AI agents deployed by Agentic Operators. These agents automatically check if a submitted Agent Prompt adheres to predefined Verification Policies. 3 Automated Prompt Verification by Agentic Operators: ‚Ä¢ Instead of manual review, we introduce Agentic Operators who deploy Verification Agents. ‚Ä¢ When a new prompt is submitted for verification, each Verification Agent automatically assesses the prompt against predefined Verification Policies (e.g., topic relevance, tone, length, keyword usage). ‚Ä¢ This automated policy check is implemented within the prompt_operator.py script. ‚Ä¢ Verification Agents generate automated verdicts ("Pass" or "Fail") based on policy compliance. 4 On-Chain Recording of Verification Outcomes: ‚Ä¢ The verdicts from Verification Agents are aggregated by the Aggregator. ‚Ä¢ The overall verification outcome (Verified or Rejected) is recorded on the Ethereum blockchain via the AVS contract, providing a transparent and auditable record. 5 Conditional Agent Execution based on Verification: ‚Ä¢ The core AI newsletter generation agent (manager agent) is designed to be "AVS-Prompt-Verification Aware." ‚Ä¢ It only proceeds to generate the newsletter content if the prompt has been verifiably Approved by the AVS operator network. ‚Ä¢ If the prompt is Rejected, the newsletter generation process is halted, ensuring that content is only created under verifiably sound instructions. Workflow Description: 1 Newsletter Creator Defines Prompt and Policies: The newsletter creator defines the Agent Prompt and a set of Verification Policies. 2 Prompt Submission to AVS: The prompt and policies are submitted to the NewsletterPromptTaskManager contract. 3 Verification Task Creation: The AVS contract creates a new "Prompt Verification Task." 4 Agentic Operators Deploy Verification Agents: Operators deploy Verification Agents that monitor the AVS for new tasks. 5 Automated Policy Check: Verification Agents automatically analyze the submitted prompt against the Verification Policies. 6 Automated Verdict Generation: Verification Agents generate "Pass/Fail" verdicts based on policy checks. 7 Verdict Aggregation and On-Chain Recording: The Aggregator collects verdicts, aggregates them, and records the overall verification outcome (Verified/Rejected) on the AVS contract. 8 Conditional Agent Execution: The Autogen newsletter agent checks the AVS for the verification outcome. If "Verified," it proceeds with newsletter generation using the approved prompt. If "Rejected," the process halts. 9 Newsletter Generation and Distribution: If verified, the Autogen agents generate the newsletter content, which is then distributed. Technology Stack: ‚Ä¢ AI Agent Framework: Autogen (for multi-agent system orchestration) ‚Ä¢ Large Language Model (LLM): GPT-4o-mini (or similar OpenAI model) ‚Ä¢ Blockchain Platform: Ethereum (simulated local Anvil chain for PoC) ‚Ä¢ Autonomous Verifiable Service (AVS) Framework: EigenLayer ‚Ä¢ Smart Contract Language: Solidity ‚Ä¢ Off-chain Components: Python (for Aggregator, Operator Agents, and main agent workflow) ‚Ä¢ Web Scraping Library: Scrapegraphai ‚Ä¢ Cryptographic Libraries: Eigensdk-python (for BLS signature aggregation) Current Project Status (Proof of Concept): This project is currently a Proof of Concept (PoC). We have implemented the core components to demonstrate the feasibility of Verifiable Agent Prompts. Key aspects currently implemented include: ‚Ä¢ Modified Solidity contracts for managing prompt verification tasks. ‚Ä¢ Aggregator component for task submission and verdict aggregation. ‚Ä¢ Simulated Prompt Operator (prompt_operator.py) with basic automated policy checking logic. ‚Ä¢ Integration with a simplified Autogen workflow in agents.py to submit prompts for verification and conditionally execute the newsletter agent. Future Development and Enhancements: ‚Ä¢ More Sophisticated Verification Policies: Implement more complex and nuanced policies, potentially using more advanced NLP techniques for policy evaluation within Verification Agents. ‚Ä¢ Diverse Verification Models: Explore using a variety of AI models within Verification Agents to increase robustness and reduce bias in the verification process. ‚Ä¢ Verifiable Tool Usage Logging and Authorization: Extend the system to verifiably log and control the tools and APIs used by the AI agents, further enhancing transparency and security. ‚Ä¢ Decentralized Policy Registry: Implement a decentralized system for managing and updating Verification Policies. ‚Ä¢ Reputation and Incentive Mechanisms for Operators: Develop a reputation system and robust economic incentives for Agentic Operators to ensure high-quality and honest prompt verification services within a real EigenLayer deployment. ‚Ä¢ Enhanced User Interface and Workflow: Create a user-friendly interface for newsletter creators to define prompts, policies, and monitor the verification and generation process. Value Proposition: The Week in Ethereum News AI Edition with Verifiable Agent Prompts offers significant value by: ‚Ä¢ Building Trust in AI-Generated News: Addresses growing concerns about AI trustworthiness by providing verifiable assurance that the newsletter content is created under reviewed and approved instructions. ‚Ä¢ Enhancing Transparency: Makes the AI content generation process more transparent and auditable, allowing users to understand the controls and policies governing the AI. ‚Ä¢ Promoting Ethical AI Development: Provides a framework for incorporating ethical considerations and policy enforcement into AI agent workflows, particularly in sensitive domains like news and information dissemination. ‚Ä¢ Demonstrating the Power of EigenLayer AVS: Showcases a practical application of EigenLayer AVS for building verifiable and trustworthy AI systems, highlighting the potential of EigenLayer for securing and enhancing AI applications on Ethereum. Target Audience: This project is relevant to: ‚Ä¢ Ethereum Community: Provides a valuable service by continuing the tradition of "Week in Ethereum News" in an innovative, AI-driven, and verifiable way. ‚Ä¢ News Consumers: Offers a more trustworthy and transparent source of information about the Ethereum ecosystem. ‚Ä¢ AI and Blockchain Developers: Serves as a practical example and a potential framework for building verifiable and accountable AI systems using EigenLayer AVS. ‚Ä¢ Researchers and Academics: Provides a case study for exploring the intersection of AI, blockchain, and verifiable computation.How it's MadeTechnology Stack - Layer by Layer: 1 Smart Contracts (Solidity Layer - On-Chain Verifiability): ‚Ä¢ Language: Solidity (version ^0.8.9) - Chosen as the standard language for smart contract development on Ethereum and for EigenLayer AVSs. ‚Ä¢ Framework/Libraries: ‚Ä¢ Foundry: Used as our smart contract development toolchain. Foundry provides: ‚Ä¢ Forge: For building, testing, and deploying Solidity contracts. Its speed and testing capabilities were crucial for rapid iteration during development. ‚Ä¢ Anvil: For local Ethereum node emulation. Anvil's speed and ease of setup were essential for local testing and development. ‚Ä¢ OpenZeppelin Contracts Upgradeable: We leveraged OpenZeppelin's upgradeable contracts library (@openzeppelin-upgrades/contracts) for contract initialization and upgradeability patterns. While upgradeability isn't strictly necessary for this PoC, using these libraries provides a more robust and standard contract structure. ‚Ä¢ EigenLayer Middleware Contracts (@eigenlayer-middleware): We directly utilized key contracts and interfaces from the EigenLayer middleware library, specifically: ‚Ä¢ @eigenlayer-middleware/src/interfaces/IServiceManager.sol: Interface for service managers. ‚Ä¢ @eigenlayer-middleware/src/BLSApkRegistry.sol, @eigenlayer-middleware/src/RegistryCoordinator.sol, @eigenlayer-middleware/src/BLSSignatureChecker.sol, @eigenlayer-middleware/src/OperatorStateRetriever.sol: Core EigenLayer components for operator registration, stake retrieval, and BLS signature verification. These were essential for building our AVS and leveraging EigenLayer's verifiable infrastructure. ‚Ä¢ @eigenlayer-middleware/src/libraries/BN254.sol: Solidity library for BN254 curve operations, necessary for BLS signature verification. ‚Ä¢ EigenLayer Contracts (@eigenlayer/contracts): Imported @eigenlayer/contracts/permissions/Pausable.sol for implementing pausable functionality in our contracts, a standard pattern in EigenLayer AVSs. ‚Ä¢ Forge-std: Used forge-std/console.sol for debugging and logging within Solidity tests and contracts (though console.log was mostly commented out in the final version). 2 Off-Chain Components (Python Layer - Agent Workflow, Aggregation, Operator Simulation): ‚Ä¢ Language: Python 3.9+ - Chosen for its rich ecosystem of AI/ML libraries (Autogen, OpenAI API), web scraping tools, and ease of use for scripting and rapid prototyping. ‚Ä¢ AI Agent Framework: Autogen (version 0.7.3) - A critical partner technology. Autogen provided the multi-agent abstraction and framework that allowed us to easily create and orchestrate the complex interactions between our specialized AI agents (Manager, Critic, Web Scraper, etc.). Its conversational agent paradigm and group chat management were key to building the Society of Mind workflow. ‚Ä¢ LLM Interface: OpenAI Python Library (openai version 1.61.1) - Used to interface with OpenAI's models (specifically gpt-4o-mini - though in practice, we likely used gpt-4o or gpt-4o-preview for better performance). Access to a powerful LLM like GPT-4o was essential for the agents' reasoning, content generation, and policy checking capabilities. ‚Ä¢ Web Scraping: Scrapegraphai (version 1.37.1) - Another key partner technology. Scrapegraphai significantly simplified the complex task of web scraping. Its AI-powered extraction capabilities allowed us to reliably extract structured information from diverse web pages with minimal coding effort for the agent logic. ‚Ä¢ BLS Signature Aggregation & Ethereum Interaction: Eigensdk-python (custom version based on git+https://github.com/zellular-xyz/eigensdk-python@2736dafd95a0898180e25e86c7756ae7dc9c4e88) - Essential for EigenLayer integration. This Python SDK provided: ‚Ä¢ BLS Signature Functionality: For generating and aggregating BLS signatures, which is core to EigenLayer's security model. ‚Ä¢ Web3.py Integration: For interacting with Ethereum smart contracts (deploying contracts, calling functions, reading events). ‚Ä¢ Client Libraries for EigenLayer Contracts: Pre-built clients and utilities for interacting with EigenLayer's core contracts (Registry Coordinator, Operator State Retriever, etc.), simplifying the integration process. ‚Ä¢ Web3.py (version 7.4.0): While Eigensdk-python wraps Web3.py, we also directly used Web3.py for some lower-level Ethereum interactions, especially in the aggregator and operator scripts. ‚Ä¢ Flask (version 3.0.3): Used to create a lightweight Flask web server in aggregator.py. This server provides a simple API endpoint (/signature) for operators to submit their signatures to the aggregator via HTTP POST requests. ‚Ä¢ Requests (version 2.32.3): Used for making HTTP requests from prompt_operator.py to the aggregator's Flask server to submit signatures. ‚Ä¢ PyYAML (version 6.0.1): Used for parsing YAML configuration files (config-files/aggregator.yaml, config-files/operator.anvil.yaml). ‚Ä¢ Python-dotenv (version 1.0.1): Used for loading environment variables from .env files, for managing API keys and configuration parameters securely. ‚Ä¢ Logging (Python's logging module): Used extensively throughout the Python scripts for logging events, debugging, and monitoring the system's operation. ‚Ä¢ Threading (Python's threading module): Used in aggregator.py to run the signature submission loop and the Flask server concurrently in separate threads. ‚Ä¢ Other Libraries: Standard Python libraries like os, json, time, dataclasses, typing, yaml, requests, web3, eth_abi, eth_account, flask were used for various utility functions, data handling, and API interactions. System Architecture - How Components are Pieced Together: 1 Smart Contracts (AVS Core): ‚Ä¢ NewsletterPromptTaskManager.sol and NewsletterPromptServiceManager.sol are deployed to a local Anvil chain (simulating Ethereum). ‚Ä¢ These contracts form the core of our EigenLayer AVS, managing tasks, recording verification outcomes, and interacting with EigenLayer's registry. ‚Ä¢ They inherit from EigenLayer middleware contracts (BLSSignatureChecker, OperatorStateRetriever, ServiceManagerBase) to leverage EigenLayer's functionalities. 2 Aggregator (Off-Chain Orchestration & Aggregation): ‚Ä¢ aggregator.py acts as the central off-chain component that bridges the AI agent workflow and the on-chain AVS contracts. ‚Ä¢ Task Submission: The Aggregator class in aggregator.py has functions (like send_new_manager_instructions_verification_task) to initiate new prompt verification tasks by calling the createNewTask function on the NewsletterPromptTaskManager contract. ‚Ä¢ Signature Reception (Flask Server): The Flask server within aggregator.py listens for incoming HTTP POST requests at the /signature endpoint. Operators (via prompt_operator.py) send their signed verdicts to this endpoint. ‚Ä¢ BLS Signature Aggregation: The BlsAggregationService (from eigensdk-python, initialized within aggregator.py) handles the aggregation of BLS signatures received from operators. ‚Ä¢ Transaction Submission (to AVS Contract): While in this PoC, the aggregator primarily receives signatures, in a more complete AVS implementation, the aggregator would also submit aggregated signatures and verification outcomes back to the AVS contract (though this part is simplified in our current PoC). ‚Ä¢ Configuration Loading: aggregator.py loads configuration parameters (contract addresses, keys, RPC URLs) from config-files/aggregator.yaml. 3 Prompt Operator (Simulated EigenLayer Operator): ‚Ä¢ prompt_operator.py simulates an EigenLayer operator. In a real EigenLayer setup, this would be run by entities restaking ETH and participating in the AVS. ‚Ä¢ Event Monitoring: prompt_operator.py uses Web3.py event filters to monitor the NewsletterPromptTaskManager contract for NewTaskCreated events. ‚Ä¢ Task Processing (process_task_event): When a new task event is detected, the process_task_event function is triggered. This function: ‚Ä¢ Retrieves the agentPrompt from the event data. ‚Ä¢ Performs automated policy checks on the prompt (in our PoC, these are basic length and keyword checks). ‚Ä¢ Determines verification_status (Approve/Reject) based on policy checks. ‚Ä¢ Generates a BLS signature for the verification_status using the operator's BLS private key (loaded from tests/keys/test.bls.key.json). ‚Ä¢ Sends the verification_status, signature, and task ID to the aggregator's Flask server via an HTTP POST request to /signature. ‚Ä¢ Key Loading & Registration: prompt_operator.py loads operator ECDSA and BLS keys from files and includes logic to register the operator with EigenLayer and the AVS (though registration is often skipped or mocked in local testing). ‚Ä¢ Configuration Loading: prompt_operator.py loads configuration parameters from config-files/operator.anvil.yaml. 4 Autogen Agents (agents.py - Newsletter Workflow): ‚Ä¢ agents.py contains the main Autogen workflow for newsletter generation. ‚Ä¢ Society of Mind Agent Setup: It defines and orchestrates a Society of Mind agent group, including manager, critic, web-scraper, coder, and telegram-poster agents. ‚Ä¢ Prompt Submission & Verification Flow (interact_freely_with_user): The interact_freely_with_user function in agents.py implements the core integration with the AVS: ‚Ä¢ It initializes the Aggregator client. ‚Ä¢ It calls aggregator.send_new_manager_instructions_verification_task() to submit the manager_instructions prompt to the AVS for verification. ‚Ä¢ It then polls (a hacky but simple PoC approach) for a certain duration, waiting for the prompt to be (assumed to be) verified by operators. ‚Ä¢ Conditional Agent Initialization: Only if the prompt verification is (assumed to be) successful, it proceeds to create and initialize the SocietyOfMindAgent and start the chat interface. ‚Ä¢ If verification is (assumed to be) rejected, it halts the agent initialization. ‚Ä¢ Agent Definitions & System Messages: agents.py defines the system messages and roles for each Autogen agent, outlining their responsibilities in the newsletter creation process. ‚Ä¢ Tool Integration: It integrates the custom tools (TelegramPostAgent, TwitterPostAgent, WebScraperAgent) into the agent workflow. Partner Technologies - Benefits: ‚Ä¢ EigenLayer AVS: Fundamental to Verifiability. EigenLayer AVS provides the core infrastructure for building verifiable services on Ethereum. It enabled us to: ‚Ä¢ Decentralize Trust: Distribute trust in the prompt verification process across a network of operators, rather than relying on a single entity. ‚Ä¢ Cryptographic Security: Leverage Ethereum's cryptoeconomic security to make the verification process tamper-proof and accountable through BLS signatures and on-chain recording. ‚Ä¢ Build a Verifiable Service: Create an AVS (NewsletterPromptTaskManager) that can be permissionlessly accessed and utilized by our AI newsletter application. ‚Ä¢ Leverage Existing Middleware: The EigenLayer middleware libraries (eigensdk-python, @eigenlayer-middleware) significantly simplified the integration with EigenLayer's complex cryptographic and on-chain components, saving us substantial development time and effort. ‚Ä¢ Autogen: Agentic Workflow Orchestration. Autogen was crucial for building the sophisticated multi-agent workflow for newsletter generation. It provided: ‚Ä¢ Multi-Agent Abstraction: Simplified the creation and management of multiple interacting AI agents. ‚Ä¢ Conversational Agent Paradigm: Enabled natural and flexible communication and collaboration between agents. ‚Ä¢ Group Chat Management: Facilitated the orchestration of the Society of Mind agent group and managed message flow. ‚Ä¢ Tool Integration: Made it easy to integrate custom tools (like our WebScraperAgent, TelegramPostAgent) into the agent workflow. ‚Ä¢ Rapid Prototyping: Autogen's ease of use and high-level abstractions allowed us to rapidly prototype and iterate on the agentic workflow for the newsletter. Notable "Hacky" or Simplified Implementation Details (for PoC): ‚Ä¢ Polling for Verification Status in agents.py: Instead of implementing a more robust event listener to react to on-chain verification events, we used a simple time.sleep() and polling loop in agents.py to check for verification status. This is inefficient and not suitable for a production system, but it was a quick way to demonstrate the basic workflow in the PoC. A proper implementation would use Web3.py event filters to asynchronously listen for PromptVerified or PromptRejected events from the AVS contract. ‚Ä¢ Manual Operator Input in prompt_operator.py (Initially): In the very first iteration of the PoC, the prompt_operator.py script required manual operator input ("yes/no") to approve or reject prompts. This was a simplification to demonstrate the basic signature submission flow, but it was quickly replaced with automated policy checks to make the operator side more agentic. ‚Ä¢ Basic Policy Checks in prompt_operator.py: The policy checks implemented in prompt_operator.py are very rudimentary (length and keyword checks). A more sophisticated system would use more advanced NLP techniques and potentially even LLMs within the Verification Agents to perform more nuanced and comprehensive policy evaluations. ‚Ä¢ Assumed Verification Success (in agents.py PoC Polling): In the agents.py polling loop, we simply assume that the prompt is verified after waiting for a certain time (verification_status = True). A real application would need to query the AVS contract to verifiably confirm the verification outcome and aggregated signature before proceeding. ‚Ä¢ Hardcoded Configurations and Paths: Configuration parameters (contract addresses, key file paths, RPC URLs) are often hardcoded or loaded from simple YAML files. A production system would require more robust configuration management, potentially using environment variables, secure key vaults, and dynamic configuration loading. ‚Ä¢ Simplified Error Handling: Error handling in the PoC is basic. A production system would need much more comprehensive error handling, logging, and monitoring to ensure robustness and reliability. ‚Ä¢ Lack of Full EigenLayer Deployment: The PoC is run on a local Anvil chain and simulates EigenLayer operators. A full deployment on a real EigenLayer testnet or mainnet would involve additional complexities related to operator registration, staking, reward distribution, and slashing mechanisms, which are not fully explored in this basic PoC. Despite these simplifications and "hacky" elements, the Week in Ethereum News AI Edition PoC successfully demonstrates the core concept of Verifiable Agent Prompts using EigenLayer AVS and showcases the potential for building more trustworthy and transparent AI-driven applications on blockchain.
summary: AI-powered Ethereum news curation, verification & distribution using decentralized EigenLayer AVS. Reviving 'Week in Ethereum News' with AI agents and blockchain-powered trust.

title: TABULA
description: Project DescriptionTabula: The DAO Intelligence Hub is an AI-powered platform built on Base to transform how individuals interact with and participate in DAOs. Designed to address the most common challenges in the DAO ecosystem, Tabula provides a comprehensive, intelligent dashboard that makes governance more intuitive and impactful. It empowers users to navigate complex DAOs, analyze proposals efficiently, and make informed decisions‚Äîall while streamlining participation and minimizing information overload. In the current DAO landscape, participants often struggle with information overload, complex proposal analysis, and time-consuming involvement. These challenges are compounded by fragmented tools and platforms that lack seamless integration. Tabula solves these issues by providing a unified governance hub with a variety of features, including an AI-powered smart assistant, data-driven impact analysis, and delegation matchmaking. The platform transmutates raw governance data into actionable insights, making DAO participation more accessible, efficient, and transparent. Links GitHub | Demo | Prototype App Slide Deck | Contribution Guide | Local Testing Guide Design Files + Figma | UI Mockups Key features Intelligent Dashboard: A comprehensive view of DAO delegations, governance health, event timelines, and more. Smart Updates Hub: Priority-based notifications, AI-curated summaries, impact analysis, and social sentiment tracking. Governance Assistant: AI-powered chat that simplifies proposal analysis, governance simulations, delegate assistance, and more. Advanced Features: User-to-Delegate matchmaking, post-execution transaction tracking, notifications, and AI-generated reports to analyze proposal impacts. Tabula is designed to make DAO participation smarter, easier, and more rewarding, ultimately contributing to more efficient governance within the Web3 ecosystem.How it's MadeCore Technologies Base: Chosen for its scalability and low fees, Base powers our transactions and ensures smooth integration with the Ethereum ecosystem. Tally API: Provides access to essential DAO data (proposals, voting, delegates) for real-time insights and analysis. LangChain & AgentKit: These frameworks power our AI assistant, enabling advanced features like proposal simulations, impact analysis, and delegate recommendations. OnchainKit & Smart Wallet: Allow users to interact directly with DAOs (e.g., voting, delegating) in a secure, seamless way. Autonome: Enhances AI capabilities like sentiment analysis and impact predictions. OneSec: Ensures secure DApp deployment and transaction integrity. Workflow Data Aggregation: The Tally API pulls DAO data, which is processed by the AI assistant to provide actionable insights and governance summaries. AI-Powered Assistant: LangChain and AgentKit power the chat interface, offering simplified explanations, impact analysis, and delegate suggestions. Direct Actions: Users can vote or delegate tokens via OnchainKit with seamless blockchain interaction. Notable Solutions Custom AI Summarization: We built a custom summarization model that‚Äôs fine-tuned for DAO proposals, delivering concise, relevant summaries. Delegate Matchmaking: Our hybrid recommendation system combines machine learning and rule-based algorithms to suggest delegates based on voting history and user preferences.
summary: Tabula streamlines DAO participation on Base by providing an intelligent, unified dashboard that transforms how users engage with DAOs. Through our alchemical process, we transmute raw governance data into clear, actionable insights.

title: publi-cit√©
description: Project DescriptionIntroducing Publi-Cite: A Web3-Powered Advertising Platform Overview: Publi-Cite is a revolutionary Web3-powered advertising platform where users earn rewards per click, third-party websites gain commissions, and companies achieve seamless ad engagement. How Publi-Cite Works: Advertiser Registration & Campaign Creation: Any advertiser can visit Publi-Cite, register, and create a campaign for their products. During the campaign setup, the advertiser must define: Reward per Click (amount paid per user click) Third-Party Commission Percentage (share for websites displaying the ads) Optional End Date (campaign duration) Funding the Campaign: Upon registration, a server wallet is automatically created using Privy Server Wallet API calls. Advertisers must fund their server wallets to activate and run campaigns. Campaign Management: Advertisers can track and manage their campaigns through the Campaign Display Section, where they can view their ads and add funds as needed. Third-Party Website Integration: Any third-party website can search for live campaigns and copy the embedded ad component to their site. Websites displaying campaigns earn commissions per user interaction. User Interaction & Rewards: When a user clicks an ad on a third-party website, the reward per click is automatically credited to their browser wallet using Web3 technology. Tech Stack: Publi-Cite leverages cutting-edge Web3 technologies to ensure security, transparency, and efficiency: Privy Server Wallet Idempotency Keys Privy Policies Engine Privy Authentication Signatures Embedded Links Future Roadmap: To enhance security and fairness, we plan to develop anti-spamming modules to prevent multiple-account exploitation and introduce advanced policy controls to regulate ad interactions. Our vision is to establish Publi-Cite as the Web3 alternative to Google Ads, offering a decentralized, fair, and rewarding digital advertising experience superior to Brave Ads. Join us in revolutionizing online advertising with Web3 technology!How it's MadeOur project revolutionizes digital advertising by utilizing Privy server wallets to automate payments for advertising campaigns. Users are rewarded with cryptocurrency for engaging with ads, providing a unique value-driven experience. By leveraging the Privy policy engine, we effectively manage reward distribution while preventing spam through the use of Idempotency keys. Despite facing challenges with documentation, the active Privy developer community on Slack helped us overcome issues swiftly, allowing us to focus on creating a seamless Web3 alternative to traditional ad platforms like Google Ads.
summary: A decentralized advertisement generating  platform that revolutionizes digital advertising by rewarding users with cryptocurrency for engaging with ads. Our platform enables companies to boost their ad engagement while providing value back to users.

title: SpaceCoin
description: Project DescriptionAn AI system deployed on the Gaia platform. This system, built on Gaia Agent Kit, is designed to constantly monitor Twitter for any mentions of new meme coins. When it detects a relevant tweet, it immediately springs into action. The AI's first task is to extract the meme coin's address from the tweet. It then uses this information to gather additional details about the coin, including its symbol and current market value. Armed with this data, the AI proceeds to mint a new token on the Arbitrum network. This new token is pegged to the value of the original meme coin, effectively creating a bridge between different blockchain ecosystems. Here's where it gets interesting for users. They can now purchase these newly minted tokens directly on the Arbitrum network, known for its fast and cost-effective transactions. But the process doesn't stop there. When a user buys the token, it triggers a series of cross-chain interactions: USDC (a popular stablecoin) is transferred from Arbitrum to the Solana blockchain. Once on Solana, this USDC is swapped for SOL, Solana's native cryptocurrency. The SOL is then used to purchase the original meme coin back on Arbitrum. This entire process is automated, allowing for seamless interaction between different blockchains. It's designed to be user-friendly, enabling people to buy and sell meme coins regardless of their preferred blockchain platform. The same mechanism works in reverse when selling the meme coin, ensuring liquidity and ease of use across multiple blockchain ecosystems. This innovative system not only broadens the adoption and liquidity of meme coins but also creates an integrated pathway for trading across diverse blockchain networks. In essence, this technology is breaking down the barriers between different blockchain ecosystems, making the world of cryptocurrency more interconnected and accessible than ever before. Also deployed on OpSec. We have also used Privy to connect wallets.How it's MadeOur project leveraged the Gaia Agent Starter Kit as a robust foundation, simplifying the integration of core components including our Foundry project for blockchain interactions. This framework streamlined the creation of the AI agent's infrastructure for Twitter monitoring, meme coin analysis, and cross-chain token operations1. We deployed the application using OpSec, which provided an intuitive interface that significantly reduced setup time and allowed us to focus on core functionality. Privy's widget was seamlessly integrated to facilitate MetaMask wallet connections, enhancing the user experience for wallet management6. While we encountered some initial challenges with Gaia node configuration, the process became more manageable once we overcame the learning curve4. Our approach to cross-chain token bridging, using custom scripts instead of off-the-shelf solutions, proved effective albeit somewhat unconventional. The supportive communities behind Gaia, Privy, and OpSec were instrumental in our development process, offering timely assistance and insights that accelerated our progress. These partner technologies allowed us to concentrate on building the essential features of our cross-chain meme coin exchange efficiently.
summary: An AI agent on Gaia monitors Twitter for new meme coins. When detected, it fetches the coin‚Äôs address, symbols, and price, then mints a pegged token on Arbitrum. Users can buy it, triggering a cross-chain process: USDC moves to Solana, swaps to SOL, and buys the meme coin.

title: DCAi
description: Project DescriptionDollar-cost averaging (DCA) is a proven strategy to accumulate assets while mitigating volatility risks, especially in bull markets. However, manual DCA execution often fails to adapt to rapid market shifts, gas fluctuations, or emerging opportunities. DCAi is an autonomous, AI-driven agent that dynamically adjusts DCA parameters (timing, size, asset allocation) in real-time using on-chain data, sentiment analysis, and predictive modeling. The AI agent also has capabilities of teaching web3 and investing concepts to users as well as supporting voice inputs and voice outputs to improve accessibility.How it's MadeThis project builds an AI Agent to implement dollar-cost-averaging using Coinbase AgentKit with openAI's langchain intelligence. The frontend is crafted using Next.js react library so that the client and server side can be managed efficiently with cost-effectiveness for the hackathon. EigenLayers Hyperbolic is also implemented for AI voice support. The solution was then deployed on Opsec's Onesec.
summary: Let AI automate & optimize your crypto DCA strategy‚Äîstack smarter, not harder.

title: Contributors
description: Project DescriptionWe are going to make an open-source contribution to Coinbase AgentKit, specifically by integrating the OpenSea marketplace. We got this idea from wishlist.md (https://github.com/coinbase/agentkit) Users will be able to list their NFTs on the marketplace using natural language. In this project, we are contributing to Coinbase‚Äôs chat system by integrating it with the renowned OpenSea platform. Our goal is to enhance the user experience by enabling seamless interaction with NFTs directly within the chat. Users can effortlessly browse their NFT collection from their wallet, select specific assets, and list them on OpenSea‚Äîall without leaving the interface. This integration streamlines the process, making NFT trading more accessible and intuitive.How it's MadeWe are going to make an open-source contribution to Coinbase AgentKit, specifically by integrating the OpenSea marketplace. We got this idea from wishlist.md (https://github.com/coinbase/agentkit) Users will be able to list their NFTs on the marketplace using natural language. We are contribution to action-providers folder creating our own action-provider
summary: PR contribution to Coinbase AgentKit (integration with OpenSea marketplace)

title: tars
description: Project DescriptionTARS (Transformative Action Recognition System) revolutionizes how we address social and environmental issues by combining wearable tech, AI agents, and blockchain governance. The problem: While people encounter numerous social issues daily, there's no automated, trustworthy system to document, verify, and act on these observations. Current solutions are either centralized, manual, or lack verification. TARS solves this through a four-layer system: Verification Layer: Custom EigenLayer AVS (Actively Validated Service) ensures media authenticity Decentralized operator network verifies content from Ray-Ban Meta glasses Cryptographic signatures prevent tampering and establish chain of custody Multiple IPFS gateways for reliable, decentralized storage Media Analysis Layer: AI agent processes verified media using Claude Vision Extracts comprehensive metadata (location, time, context) Aggregates local weather history and relevant news Generates detailed environmental/social impact analysis Impact Assessment Layer: Specialized agent evaluates issues using multi-factor scoring Automatically generates DAO proposals for high-impact issues Smart contract integration for transparent fund management Community voting and proposal execution Agent Network Layer: Scalable network for multiple AI agents and wearable devices Automated coordination between verification and analysis agents Cross-agent data sharing and consensus Expandable framework for future agent integration Key Features: Trustless media verification Automated context gathering Impact-based prioritization Decentralized governance Transparent fund allocation Real-time social issue monitoring Future Vision: TARS aims to create a global network of AI agents and wearable devices that continuously monitor and address social/environmental issues, making social impact initiatives more efficient, transparent, and actionable.How it's MadeI built TARS as a bridge between real-world social initiatives and Web3 governance, starting with the challenge of verifying media from Ray-Ban Meta glasses. My core innovation is a custom AVS (Actively Validated Service) on EigenLayer that verifies image authenticity, paired with Claude Vision for AI analysis. This combination allows me to reliably process media from capture to verification while maintaining data integrity through a multi-gateway IPFS storage system using Pinata. The trickiest part was building the impact assessment system that powers the DAO. I developed a network of TypeScript agents using the ELIZA framework to gather context from multiple sources‚Äîweather data, local news, and location information‚Äîto score social initiatives. These agents feed into Arbitrum-based DAO smart contracts, which handle community voting and fund allocation. I used the Exifr library to extract raw image metadata, EigenLayer to build the AVS, and Pinata IPFS to store all files and media for verification. The system integrates the Claude Vision API, Dynamic Wallet for human accessibility, and Arbitrum Sepolia Testnet for the DAO smart contracts and voting. For the frontend, I used React JS, and last but not least, Ray-Ban Meta Smart Glasses to capture media. The end result is a system that successfully bridges the gap between real-world social initiatives and decentralized governance while maintaining data integrity and user trust throughout the entire pipeline.
summary: TARS: A decentralized network of AI agents that capture, verify, and act on social/environmental issues using EigenLayer AVS. From Ray-Ban Meta glasses to DAO proposals, creating a trustless pipeline for social impact initiatives.

title: Synapze
description: Project DescriptionSynapze is an AI hosting platform specifically designed to deploy autonomous agents built using the ElizaOS framework, providing a streamlined solution that makes advanced AI deployment accessible for both seasoned developers and newcomers alike. At its core, Synapze simplifies the entire process of launching AI agents by offering a one-click deployment feature that eliminates the usual complexities associated with traditional setups. This means that instead of grappling with numerous manual steps, users can instantly bring their AI agents online with minimal effort. The platform stands out by offering multiple deployment options to different user preferences and technical expertise. Whether you prefer to manually enter agent details through an intuitive form, upload a pre-configured characterfile in JSON format, or choose from a variety of predefined templates, Synapze adapts to your workflow. This flexibility allows you to create detailed, customized agents that reflect your desired personality and style, making it possible to fine-tune their behavior, tone, and interaction patterns with precision. Security and seamless integration are also central to the Synapze experience. Essential credentials, including those required for external services like Discord, Twitter, Farcaster, etc... and LLM providers, are managed securely through environment variables. This integrated approach not only safeguards sensitive information but also ensures that your agent has reliable access to the services it needs to function properly. Once deployment is initiated, Synapze provides real-time monitoring and updates through a dedicated progress page, allowing you to track the agent's status from start to finish. Synapze simplifies AI agents integration with advanced on-chain capabilities through Coinbase AgentKit/OnchainKit and Autonomous Verifiable Services (AVS). This powerful combination allows developers to build and deploy sophisticated, blockchain-integrated AI agents with unprecedented ease and reliability. Synapze not only simplifies the deployment and management of AI agents with its user-friendly interface and extensive documentation but also pushes the boundaries of innovation by integrating on-chain functionalities. This unique blend of AI and blockchain technology enables the creation of intelligent, autonomous agents that can interact with both digital data and decentralized networks.How it's MadeThis project is using a streamlined, modern tech stack. Our backend is written in TypeScript with REST and GraphQL APIs, while our blockchain interactions rely on Solidity smart contracts and Rust modules for performance-critical tasks. A PostgreSQL database handles our persistent storage. To enable onchain functionality, we integrated Coinbase‚Äôs AgentKit and OnchainKit‚Äîthese toolkits empower our AI agents to access crypto wallets and perform blockchain transactions, and they simplify app development with ergonomic, pre-built components. We also leveraged the EigenLayer SDK to enhance security and scalability. A custom middleware layer bridges our web APIs with blockchain operations, handling tasks like transaction batching and error reconciliation. This careful orchestration, along with a few hacky scripts for data conversion, allowed us to seamlessly merge offchain and onchain features into a cohesive, efficient platform.
summary: Synapze is a one-click AI agent hosting platform built for Eliza-based agents. Enjoy streamlined deployment and real-time monitoring.

title: Aegis Agent
description: Project DescriptionAegis AI is an autonomous smart contract security monitor that revolutionizes how we protect DeFi protocols. Here's how it works: Core Features: 24/7 autonomous transactions monitoring 5-minute threat detection (vs. industry's 47-hour average) Automatic contract pausing when threats are detected Real-time email alerts with threat analysis User-friendly dashboard for monitoring multiple contracts Technical Stack: Coinbase's CDP AgentKit for autonomous monitoring and contract interaction OnchainKit for seamless wallet integration and user interface The Graph Protocol for efficient event tracking and data indexing Base Network for reliable, low-cost transactions Autonome for AI agent deployment and hosting SendGrid for instant email notifications Security Process: Users connect their wallet and add contracts to monitor Our AI agent continuously analyzes: Transaction patterns, Interaction with blacklisted addresses, Suspicious value transfers, Known attack vectors (flash loans, reentrancy, etc.) When threats are detected: Instantly sends detailed alerts to stakeholders. Can automatically pause vulnerable contracts, Provides real-time analysis in the dashboard Impact: Could prevent 72% of common DeFi attacks Enables 89% fund recovery rate through quick detection Makes enterprise-grade security accessible to all DeFi projects The project solves a critical problem in DeFi where slow threat detection leads to massive losses. By combining AI, autonomous agents, and real-time monitoring, we've created a practical solution that could save billions in potential hacks while making DeFi safer for everyone.How it's MadeBackend: Built with Python/Flask, powered by CDP AgentKit for autonomous monitoring. We created custom actions for transaction analysis, block monitoring, and alert notifications. The system uses SQLite for data storage and SendGrid for instant email alerts. Frontend: Next.js/React application with OnchainKit for wallet connections. Features a real-time dashboard using WebSocket for live updates. Uses Tailwind CSS for a clean, responsive interface with emoji-based threat indicators (üü¢ safe, üü° suspicious, üî¥ critical). Data & Network: Leverages The Graph Protocol for efficient event indexing and Base Network for fast, low-cost transactions. Maintains Etherscan API as backup for reliable monitoring. Key Innovation: Our autonomous system combines these technologies to detect and respond to threats in 5 minutes (vs industry's 47 hours). When threats are detected, the agent can automatically pause contracts using CDP AgentKit's MPC wallet integration, potentially preventing millions in losses.
summary: An AI-driven agent that monitors transactions 24/7, detects anomalies, and triggers alerts/emergency actions.

title: LeBrown Jones
description: Project DescriptionThe project is aimed at being the first step toward fully autonomous and consistent social media presences. We have seen how popular X/Twitter agents such as aixbt, Luna, and VaderAI are, and they are also tokenized and valued at millions of dollars. These agents are far from perfect and are limited to certain domains and platforms. My eventual goal was to start with building something similar, and then slowly extend it across platforms and use cases, developing a virtual character that is both useful and entertaining. In this project, I explored the basics of building a Twitter agent that automatically posts, in this case pro-LeBron James propaganda and statistics. Additionally, I also built and hosted a web application with a LLM chat interface for fans/users of the LeBron fan personality to directly interact with. These represent two of the primary use cases for future extensions: a social media presence and a interactive terminal.How it's MadeThe primary technologies were Coinbase's Agent Kit for implementing the base Twitter agent, Twitter API, Tweetpy, Eleven Labs for Text-to-Speech and voice design for the character, Next.js for front end, Firework's for LLM API calls, Dobby by SentientAGI for zero-guardrails unhinged LLM output generation. Cursor for development, and Claude for ideation and refinement.
summary: LeBrown Jones is a X/Twitter Agent personality for real time statistics and live NBA reactions. Lebrown Jones Terminal is a content creation platform to automatically generate multimodal media to honor and glaze the goat Lebron James.

title: X INTEGRATION
description: Project DescriptionThe Twitter tool is a sophisticated AI Agent SDK component designed to enable AI agents to interact with Twitter programmatically. Enhanced Agent Abilities: Dynamically generate and post tweets Share blockchain insights Perform real-time market commentary Create automated social media campaigns Practical Use Cases Blockchain Event Reporting Automatically tweet about significant blockchain transactions Share market insights Provide real-time network status updates Community Engagement Answer common questions Share educational content Provide automated support Market Sentiment Analysis Track and respond to trending blockchain discussions Generate summary tweets about market movements Technical Innovation: Tool Integration How it's MadeThe Twitter Tool transforms AI agents from passive analyzers to active, communicative entities capable of real-time social media interaction. üèóÔ∏è AI Agent SDK: The Technical Odyssey üîß Core Technology Stack Language: TypeScript Runtime: Node.js Package Management: pnpm Testing: Vitest Type Validation: Zod üåê Key Dependencies { "dependencies": { "@covalenthq/client-sdk": "^2.2.3", "twitter-api-v2": "^1.18.2", "openai": "^4.79.1", "zod": "^3.24.1" } } Partner Technology Integration Covalent Blockchain SDK Purpose: Blockchain data retrieval Benefits: Rich blockchain transaction insights Seamless data integration Enhanced agent capabilities Twitter API v2 Purpose: Social media interaction Benefits: Modern API features Robust authentication Comprehensive tweet management The architecture allows easy addition of new Twitter-related tools: Account follows Media Upload Tweet reply functionality Security Considerations Never hardcode API credentials Use environment variables Validate all credentials before API interaction Unique Technical Challenges Solved Seamless integration of Twitter API with AI agents Robust, type-safe configuration management Intelligent error handling and reporting
summary: A twitter/x integration for covalent-ai-sdk to enable ai gents make twitter posts

title: sepiol_storage
description: Project DescriptionWe built git for agentic robots. Traditionally, robotic agents in simulated environments and robotic agents in physical robots exist in two separate constructs. Sepiol Storage unifies the two. In its current form, Sepiol Storage provides a decentralized repository that creates a common representation between virtual and physical robotics agents. It unlocks a decentralized system to train robots across a decentralized system and capture affordance (functional) and safety attestations. How it works: Embodiment classes and instances of those embodiments are registered on the Arbitrum blockchain. When a new Embodiment is added, a digital twin is generated, which can be used in a Genesis simulation for ML training, identity management, ability attestation, and future development of functionality. When an instance of that embodiment is added, the unique identifier (transaction id) is added to the physical model before it's sent to a 3D printer and assembled. Long-term, we seek to answer the following questions: What happens in the future when you have thousands of the same robots on another planet trying to accomplish something? How does the system distribute resources and learn across robots? How can we balance evolution with moral alignment in a decentralized and distributed world?How it's MadeSepiol Storage utilizes the Arbitrum blockchain for robot identity storage. Under 'Digital Twin' generation, Roboforge is used for CAD to URDF (format for simulation in Genesis) conversion. Pyvista is used for identity bridging, adding the unique identifier of the digital twin to the 3D-printed model. Genesis is used for simulation and model training. Next.js is used for the user-facing application that connects embodiment and entity registration to the blockchain.
summary: Sepiol Storage is git for robotic agents: Unlocking decentralized identification, training, and attestation. Bridging physical and simulated environments.

title: Asset
description: Project DescriptionAsset is an intelligent DeFi advisory tool that provides personalized investment recommendations by assessing the user's risk appetite. The platform integrates gamification to make the risk assessment process engaging and interactive. Users take a questionnaire that presents various financial and investment scenarios, allowing them to choose responses that best align with their preferences and risk tolerance. Based on their responses, a scoring system assigns a risk personality (e.g., Conservative, Moderate, Aggressive, or Experimental). Leveraging this personality classification along with the user's on-chain wallet data, Asset generates strategic DeFi investment recommendations. The platform analyzes the user's transaction history, token holdings, and previous DeFi interactions to identify the most suitable investment strategies, such as staking, yield farming, liquidity providing, or governance participation. Additionally, Asset integrates with a Telegram bot, enabling users to receive recommendations and interact with the system in real-time. The project aims to democratize DeFi investments by simplifying complex strategies and ensuring users make informed decisions based on their unique financial behavior and preferences. Key Features: Gamified Risk Assessment: An interactive questionnaire that assigns a risk score to each user. Personality-Based Investment Strategies: Categorization into investment personas to tailor DeFi strategies. On-Chain Wallet Analysis: Extraction of insights from wallet transactions to fine-tune recommendations. Automated Strategy Suggestions: Recommendations for staking, lending, yield farming, and more. Telegram Bot Integration: Users can interact and receive recommendations through Telegram. User Education & Insights: Explainable investment suggestions to help users understand DeFi opportunities. User Flow: Connect Wallet: Users connect their Web3 wallet to Asset. Take the Risk Questionnaire: Users answer a series of gamified questions. Personality Assignment: Based on responses, the system assigns a risk-based personality type. Wallet Data Analysis: Asset scans transaction history and token holdings. Generate Personalized Recommendations: The platform suggests DeFi strategies based on personality and wallet data.How it's MadeFrontend + Backend : Next.js (React-based UI) Blockchain Integration: Moralis (Fetch data), Agentkit for AAVE deposits, Twitter Share button User Flow -- Connect Wallet: Users connect their Web3 wallet to Asset. (Smart wallet + onchainkit) Take the Risk Questionnaire: Users answer a series of gamified questions. Personality Assignment: Based on responses, the system assigns a risk-based personality type. Wallet Data Analysis: Asset scans transaction history and token holdings. Generate Personalized Recommendations: The platform suggests DeFi strategies based on personality and wallet data. Receive Updates via Telegram: Users can opt-in for ongoing strategy updates and alerts. ( future scope)
summary: Asset is a smart DeFi tool that customizes investment strategies based on the user‚Äôs risk appetite

title: CookFi AI
description: Project DescriptionCookFi AI is the first fully autonomous trading agent powered by Cookie3's real-time data feeds, built on ElizaOS, and using Coinbase SDK for trading on Base. Unlike traditional bots that require manual inputs, and unlike most ‚Äútrading agents‚Äù that require users to ask the agent to place specific trades, CookFi AI trades on its own, analyzing live market conditions and making high-speed, high-accuracy trades to maximize profits‚Äîpassively and efficiently. How It Works: Deposit Funds ‚Äì Send funds to CookFi‚Äôs trading wallet. No complex setup. Autonomous Execution ‚Äì CookFi AI monitors the market 24/7, identifying high-profit opportunities in real time on Base and Solana. Sniping & Adaptive Trading ‚Äì Reacts instantly to new trends, frontrunning opportunities before the market catches on. Compounding Growth ‚Äì Trades smartly to optimize gains over time, adjusting strategies dynamically. Why CookFi AI? Real-Time Market Awareness ‚Äì Trades faster and smarter with instant market intelligence from Cookie3 Data Swarm and other sources. No Manual Input Needed ‚Äì Just fund it and watch it work. Trend Sniping & Arbitrage ‚Äì Captures profitable trades before others react. Let CookFi AI do the trading‚Äîyou just collect the profits. Get started today.How it's MadeArchitecture: We built using elizaOS an AI-powered autonomous trading system based on ReAct + Prompt Chaining pattern. The workflow: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Gather token data from APIs (market data: dexscreener, moralis, top wallets + social data: cookie.fun) 2Ô∏è‚É£ LLM decides: BUY, SELL, or HOLD based on reasoning, confidence & risks 3Ô∏è‚É£ We use Coinbase SDK to enable trading on Base, and Solana agent kit to execute trades on Solana Schema: https://excalidraw.com/#room=83cb3e93dfb3fe3902df,fiQ3UUtvCmfw2oyxkiP6LA Agent Core: We built out the core of our agent using the ElizaOS agent framework. Plugins: We built various data streams to our agent that make up his ‚Äúbrain‚Äù. These were made by taking various APIs and wrapping them in an Eliza plugin, so our agent can access the data in real time. Coinbase SDK Plugin: A wrapper we made around coinbase SDK that lets our agent interact with tokens and contracts on coinbase. Cookie3 Plugin: Gives us access to real time posts from X that we then run sentiment analysis on to determine crypto market trends. Moralis Plugin: Gives us trending tokens, historic price, and a ton of other information. Dexscreener Plugin: Gives us a lot of token and wallet data that we can use to see trends and discover new tokens. TopWallets Plugin: Gives us data on influencer‚Äôs wallets, how they are trading, and lets us run meta-analysis comparing wallets to assess bigger trends. AI Context: We added context around how to do basic trading strategy to our Eliza agent. This is not ‚Äútraining‚Äù per se its just additional context that gets added to agent prompts to get better responses. Chain: Everything is live on base mannet and solana mainnet, fully automated.
summary: CookFI is the trading agent with actual intelligence! He has access to data streams from Cookie3, Dexscreener, TopWallets and more to make smart decisions with.

title: AiVS
description: Project DescriptionAiVS (short for AI Agents + AVS) is a framework that leverages the power of AI-driven decision-making in conjunction with decentralized Autonomous/Actively Validation Services (such as EigenLayer) to securely distribute tasks and verify outcomes on-chain. By combining a diverse panel of AI ‚Äúoperators‚Äù with a public and tamper-proof ledger, AiVS ensures that any type of task‚Äîwhether in law, finance, content moderation, or beyond‚Äîcan be evaluated fairly, transparently, and efficiently. For this hackathon we created the use case of a fair distributed justice system, which illustrates how AiVS can revolutionize the legal intake and adjudication process, offering a glimpse of its potential across countless domains. Here's how we describe this project: Imagine a world where filing and adjudicating legal cases is fast, transparent, and secure‚Äîwhere decisions are formed by a committee of diverse AI agents from different jurisdictions and ideologies, and the process is recorded immutably on-chain. That is exactly what this new system aims to achieve by harnessing the power of crypto (via EigenLayer AVS) and AI-driven ‚Äújuries.‚ÄùHow it's MadeWe've used typescript and solidity for creating the core AiVS (EigenLayer AVS) and the operators (jury, judge) including the aggregation, we have designed the backend modules (operator code) to be as micro services to use RestFul APIs to communicate with each other. As for the user facing UI (Clerk Intake) we aimed to use Autonome custom UI for a chat interface, however up to the last 24 hours we were unable to get it to work as it would stay in "deploying" state, so we developed a simple chat interface (HTML, python, flask) and Gaia API, which uses CDP AgentKit and IPFS to file the case on chain.
summary: A multi AI Agent framework that utilizes EigenLayer AVS for a distributed justice system

title: Orca_Protocol
description: Project DescriptionHorizon AI is a state-of-the-art trading platform designed to automate trading decisions, allowing users to generate profits effortlessly. Users can either configure their agents manually or leverage AI to create a trading agent tailored to their specific needs. Once set up, the agent autonomously executes trades. During the demo, our agent successfully completed its first trade, achieving a 100% success rate. Users can view all their agents on a dedicated page and track real-time performance through a comprehensive dashboard, which presents key trading metrics and insights.How it's MadeHorizon AI integrates cutting-edge technologies to deliver an intelligent and efficient trading experience. The platform leverages AI-driven decision-making algorithms for trade execution and incorporates a seamless user interface. It utilizes CDP AgentKit to enable autonomous trading strategies, allowing users to deploy agents that analyze market trends and execute trades optimally. Users can interact with the system through a structured dashboard that provides an overview of all trading activities. By combining automation with real-time analytics and CDP AgentKit's capabilities, Horizon AI empowers users to trade efficiently without constant manual intervention.
summary: Horizon AI ‚Äì an autonomous trading platform that uses AI to execute trades and generate profits seamlessly.

title: SmartFlow
description: Project DescriptionThis project is a system that tracks and analyzes large whale trades on Base mainnet and Ethereum mainnet through a chatbot. Whale trades can significantly impact market liquidity and price movements, making real-time monitoring essential for traders and analysts. The system integrates The Graph to index whale transactions on both Base and Ethereum, while Alchemy‚Äôs API provides real-time on-chain insights. Additionally, Coinbase‚Äôs Agent Kit enhances automation by enabling custom transaction monitoring and event-driven alerts. The backend processes this data and serves it through a chatbot, allowing users to query large transactions instantly. This automation eliminates the need for manual blockchain exploration and provides actionable insights in seconds.How it's MadeThe project is built using The Graph, Alchemy API, Coinbase Agent Kit, TypeScript, and Node.js to analyze and deliver whale trade insights across Base and Ethereum mainnets. The Graph Protocol: A custom subgraph indexes and filters large whale transactions on Base and Ethereum. Alchemy API: Fetches real-time transaction data to ensure accuracy and up-to-date insights. Coinbase Agent Kit: Enables automated transaction monitoring Backend (Node.js & Express with TypeScript): Aggregates and structures data from The Graph, Alchemy, and Coinbase Agent Kit for analysis. Chatbot Integration: Users can interact with the system to get instant whale trade insights through a simple query.
summary: Smart Flow is an AI-driven crypto analytics platform that tracks whale movements, analyzes market trends, and offers real-time trading insights. Using blockchain data, AI predictions, and smart contracts, it helps users make informed buy/sell decisions.

title: Obxialabs
description: Project DescriptionObxiaLabs is revolutionizing Web3 business automation with AI-driven solutions. Our latest tool enhances productivity by automating Instagram DMs, providing instant, intelligent replies to engage your audience effortlessly. No more missed messages‚Äîjust seamless communication, 24/7. Boost your efficiency, scale your outreach, and let AI handle the conversations while you focus on growth. Welcome to the future of Web3 automation with ObxiaLabs! üöÄHow it's MadeThis project is a combination of modern web, blockchain, and AI technologies, each playing a crucial role in shaping its functionality. Frontend: I used Next.js for its server-side rendering, static generation, and API route capabilities, which helped optimize performance. The component-based architecture made the UI modular and reusable. Styling: Tailwind CSS allowed for rapid styling with utility classes, eliminating the need to write custom CSS from scratch while keeping the design highly flexible. Blockchain Integration: The project is built on Base, a Layer 2 blockchain by Coinbase, which ensures fast and cost-efficient transactions. I leveraged smart contracts to handle key blockchain functionalities. AI Integration: I utilized AgentKit by Coinbase to power AI-driven automation and decision-making processes. This added an intelligent layer to the project, enhancing user experience and functionality.
summary: A DeFi-based AI agent for business automation, helping companies streamline marketing, boost productivity, and optimize operations effortlessly.

title: Gameland
description: Project DescriptionGameland ‚Äì AI-Powered Web3 Game Development Platform Gameland is a decentralized AI-driven game development platform designed to simplify Web3 game creation through multi-agent collaboration, automation, and blockchain integration. The platform enables developers‚Äîboth technical and non-technical‚Äîto build, deploy, and manage on-chain games with minimal effort, leveraging AI agents to automate smart contract generation, game logic design, and asset management. Core Features & Capabilities 1Ô∏è‚É£ Text-to-Web3Game (AI-Driven Game Creation) ÔÇ∑Developers can generate on-chain games by simply describing their game idea in text. ÔÇ∑AI Agents translate these descriptions into functional game code, smart contracts, and economic models. ÔÇ∑This drastically reduces the complexity of Web3 game development and accelerates deployment. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Multi-Agent Collaboration for Development ÔÇ∑Gameland introduces a team of specialized AI agents, each with distinct expertise: oGame Logic Agent: Designs and refines in-game mechanics. oSmart Contract Agent: Automates contract generation and deployment. oArt & Asset Agent: Assists in generating in-game assets and environments. ÔÇ∑These agents collaborate seamlessly to optimize the game development process. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Blockchain Deployment & Multi-Chain Support ÔÇ∑Gameland supports direct game deployment to blockchain networks, ensuring full on-chain functionality. ÔÇ∑Currently, the platform is live on BNBChain testnet, with plans to expand to Polygon, Starknet, and Somnia for broader Web3 adoption. 4Ô∏è‚É£ No-Code & Low-Code Development ÔÇ∑Provides drag-and-drop tools and pre-built game templates, enabling users to create Web3 games without extensive coding knowledge. ÔÇ∑Developers can modify AI-generated game logic through an intuitive UI, making Web3 game development more accessible. 5Ô∏è‚É£ Open Market & AI Agent Economy ÔÇ∑Developers can hire AI Agents for specific tasks, accelerating their workflow. ÔÇ∑An open marketplace allows users to buy, sell, and trade game assets, AI services, and smart contract templates. ÔÇ∑AI Agents can be customized and upgraded to provide specialized development capabilities. 6Ô∏è‚É£ Seamless Smart Contract Automation ÔÇ∑AI automates the writing, deployment, and optimization of blockchain smart contracts, eliminating manual coding errors. ÔÇ∑The system ensures efficient gas optimization and security compliance for game-related smart contracts. 7Ô∏è‚É£ Decentralized Governance & Economic Models ÔÇ∑Games developed on Gameland can implement DAO-based governance, allowing players and creators to vote on game updates and policies. ÔÇ∑AI-generated economic models optimize in-game economies, ensuring sustainability and preventing token inflation. Why Gameland Matters ÔÇ∑Reduces Web3 Game Development Complexity: AI automates technical processes, making game development accessible to a wider audience. ÔÇ∑Speeds Up Deployment: AI-generated contracts and game logic enable faster launches. ÔÇ∑Empowers Developers & Players: Multi-agent AI collaboration creates a dynamic and customizable game development experience. ÔÇ∑Expands Web3 Gaming Ecosystem: With multi-chain support, Gameland enhances accessibility across different blockchain environments. Conclusion Gameland is pioneering a new era of AI-driven Web3 game development, removing technical barriers, increasing efficiency, and enabling more creators to participate in the decentralized gaming revolution.How it's MadeHow Gameland is Built ‚Äì Technical Breakdown Core Technologies & Architecture Gameland is developed using a modular AI-powered framework that integrates multiple technologies to facilitate automated Web3 game development, blockchain deployment, and AI-driven collaboration. The system is structured into three key layers: 1Ô∏è‚É£ AI Agent Layer (Game Development Automation) ÔÇ∑LLM & Fine-Tuned Models: oUses OpenAI, Claude (Anthropic), and custom-trained models to process user inputs and generate smart contracts, game logic, and economic models. oFine-tuned models are trained on Web3 gaming data to improve context-specific responses. ÔÇ∑Multi-Agent System: oImplements LangChain and custom AI pipelines to enable multiple AI agents to work collaboratively. oAgents are specialized for different tasks, including contract generation, game logic, asset creation, and economic modeling. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Blockchain Integration & Smart Contracts ÔÇ∑Smart Contract Generation & Deployment: oUses Solidity for EVM-based chains (BNBChain, Polygon zkEVM, Somnia) and Cairo for Starknet. oAI automatically generates, audits, and deploys smart contracts, optimizing gas efficiency and ensuring security compliance. ÔÇ∑Multi-Chain Deployment: oUses Cross-Chain Messaging Protocols for interoperability and seamless deployment across multiple chains. oSmart contract templates are pre-configured to adapt to different blockchain environments. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Game Logic & Development Framework ÔÇ∑Text-to-Web3Game: oNatural language descriptions are converted into game code and logic using AI-generated blueprints. oIntegrates Godot for 2D/3D game rendering and Three.js for lightweight Web3-based browser games. ÔÇ∑No-Code & Low-Code Development: oUses Next.js & React for the frontend, ensuring a seamless developer experience. Notable Hacks & Innovative Workarounds üîπ AI-Assisted Smart Contract Debugging ÔÇ∑The system runs automated AI reviews on generated smart contracts, identifying potential vulnerabilities and suggesting fixes before deployment. üîπ Self-Improving AI Agents ÔÇ∑AI Agents learn from developer feedback, dynamically refining game logic and contract optimizations over time. üîπ Composable Game Templates ÔÇ∑Gameland allows developers to remix and modify existing AI-generated games, similar to an "open-source modular game studio". How Partner Technologies Benefit Gameland ‚úÖ BNBChain Testnet ‚Äì Used for current AI contract deployment & gas optimizations. ‚úÖ Polygon zkEVM ‚Äì Supports low-cost rollups and scalability for on-chain gaming. ‚úÖ Starknet (Cairo) ‚Äì Enables next-gen, high-performance smart contract execution. ‚úÖ LLM APIs (OpenAI, Claude) ‚Äì Drives AI agent decision-making and contract automation. Conclusion Gameland is built as an AI-first, multi-chain Web3 game development framework, designed to automate smart contract deployment, game creation, and in-game economies. The system leverages cutting-edge AI models, modular smart contracts, and seamless blockchain integrations, making Web3 game development faster, more scalable, and accessible to a broader audience.
summary: Gameland Provides a multi-agent system to automatically develop and publish Web3 games framework.

title: NexWallet
description: Project DescriptionNexWallet is an advanced wallet management platform that integrates blockchain technology with artificial intelligence to provide users with a seamless and intelligent experience. The platform supports multiple blockchain networks, including Solana, Base, Ethereum, and Arbitrum, allowing users to manage their assets across different ecosystems effortlessly. Key Features: Multi-Chain Support: Users can interact with various blockchain networks, enabling a diverse range of transactions and asset management. AI-Driven Interactions: The platform offers both text and voice command capabilities, allowing users to manage their wallets and execute transactions using natural language.
